  9787                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9788                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9789                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9790                                  
  9791                                  		; 19/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9792                                  cmos_clock_read:
  9793 00002880 50                      		push	ax
  9794 00002881 51                      		push	cx
  9795 00002882 52                      		push	dx
  9796 00002883 55                      		push	bp
  9797 00002884 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  9798                                  loop_clock:
  9799 00002886 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  9800 00002888 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9801 0000288A B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  9802 0000288C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9803                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  9804                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  9805                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  9806                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9807                                  		;cmp	cx, 0
  9808 0000288E 21C9                    		and	cx, cx
  9809 00002890 750F                    		jnz	short clock_present
  9810                                  		;cmp	dx, 0
  9811 00002892 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  9812 00002894 750B                    		jnz	short clock_present
  9813                                  		;cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  9814                                  		;je	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  9815 00002896 21ED                    		and	bp, bp
  9816 00002898 751A                    		jnz	short no_readdate
  9817 0000289A 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  9818                                  		;mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  9819                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9820 0000289B B540                    		mov	ch, 40h ; cx = 4000h ; 16384
  9821                                  delay:					
  9822 0000289D E2FE                    		loop	delay
  9823 0000289F EBE5                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  9824                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9825                                  
  9826                                  clock_present:
  9827                                  		;mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  9828                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9829                                  		; ds = cs
  9830 000028A1 C606[8C04]01            		mov	byte [havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  9831                                  		
  9832 000028A6 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  9833                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  9834                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  9835 000028A9 56                      		push	si
  9836 000028AA E8BEEF                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  9837 000028AD FA                      		cli
  9838                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  9839 000028AE 8936[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  9840 000028B2 FB                      		sti
  9841 000028B3 5E                      		pop	si
  9842                                  no_readdate:
  9843 000028B4 5D                      		pop	bp
  9844 000028B5 5A                      		pop	dx
  9845 000028B6 59                      		pop	cx
  9846 000028B7 58                      		pop	ax
  9847                                  
  9848                                  cmosck9:	; 19/12/2023
  9849 000028B8 C3                      		retn
  9850                                  
  9851                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9852                                  
  9853                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  9854                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  9855                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  9856                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  9857                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  9858                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  9859                                  ;
  9860                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  9861                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  9862                                  ;
  9863                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  9864                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  9865                                  ;
  9866                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  9867                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  9868                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  9869                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  9870                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  9871                                  ;
  9872                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  9873                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  9874                                  
  9875                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits
  9876                                  
  9877                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  9878                                  
  9879                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9880                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  9881                                  
  9882                                  	; 19/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9883                                  	
  9884                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9885                                  		; ds = cs
  9886                                  		;push	ax ; not necessary ; 19/12/2023
  9887                                  		;
  9888 000028B9 803E[AF05]FC            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FCh
  9889                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  9890 000028BE 75F8                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  9891 000028C0 803E[B005]06            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 6 ; 21/04/2024
  9892                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  9893                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  9894 000028C5 7407                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS periodic rate if 06
  9895 000028C7 803E[B005]04            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 4
  9896                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  9897                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  9898 000028CC 73EA                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST
  9899                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0
  9900                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  9901                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE
  9902                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06
  9903                                  cmosck4:
  9904 000028CE B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  9905                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  9906 000028D0 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  9907                                  					; Set divider & rate selection
  9908 000028D2 E80B00                  		call	cmos_write
  9909 000028D5 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  9910                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  9911 000028D7 E82000                  		call	cmos_read
  9912 000028DA 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  9913                                  					; clear SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  9914 000028DC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  9915 000028DE B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  9916                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  9917                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9918                                  		;call	cmos_write
  9919                                  ;cmosck9:
  9920                                  		;pop	ax ; 19/12/2023
  9921                                  		;retn
  9922                                  
  9923                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9924                                  		;jmp	short cmos_write
  9925                                  
  9926                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9927                                  
  9928                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9929                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  9930                                  ;									       :
  9931                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  9932                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  9933                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  9934                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  9935                                  ;									       :
  9936                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  9937                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  9938                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  9939                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  9940                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  9941                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  9942                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9943                                  
  9944                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)
  9945 000028E0 9C                      		pushf			;
  9946 000028E1 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  9947 000028E2 FA                      		cli
  9948 000028E3 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  9949 000028E4 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  9950 000028E6 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  9951                                  					; RTC Seconds
  9952 000028E8 90                      		nop
  9953 000028E9 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  9954 000028EB E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  9955 000028ED 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  9956 000028EE 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  9957 000028F0 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  9958 000028F2 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  9959                                  					; RTC Seconds
  9960 000028F4 90                      		nop
  9961 000028F5 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  9962 000028F7 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  9963                                  
  9964                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9965                                  		;push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  9966                                  		;call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  9967                                  		;retn
  9968 000028F8 EB18                    		jmp	short cmos_rw_popf
  9969                                  
  9970                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9971                                  
  9972                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  9973                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  9974                                  ;									       :
  9975                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  9976                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  9977                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  9978                                  ;									       :
  9979                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  9980                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled. during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  9981                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  9982                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  9983                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  9984                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  9985                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9986                                  
  9987                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)
  9988 000028FA 9C                      		pushf
  9989 000028FB FA                      		cli
  9990 000028FC 53                      		push	bx
  9991                                  		;push	ax ; *		; AL = cmos table address to be read
  9992                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9993 000028FD 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax ; * ; input
  9994 000028FF 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  9995 00002901 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  9996                                  					; RTC Seconds
  9997 00002903 90                      		nop			; (undocumented delay needed)
  9998 00002904 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  9999                                  		
 10000                                  		;mov	bx, ax ; output
 10001                                  		;pop	ax ; * ; input
 10002                                  
 10003                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10004                                  		; al = output, bl = input
 10005 00002906 93                      		xchg	ax, bx ; *
 10006                                  		; bl = output, al = input
 10007                                  	
 10008 00002907 2480                    		and	al, 80h
 10009 00002909 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
 10010 0000290B E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
 10011                                  					; RTC Seconds
 10012 0000290D 90                      		nop
 10013 0000290E E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
 10014                                  		;mov	ax, bx ; * ; output
 10015                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10016 00002910 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
 10017 00002911 5B                      		pop	bx
 10018                                  
 10019                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10020                                  cmos_rw_popf:
 10021 00002912 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
 10022 00002913 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
 10023 00002916 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
 10024                                  
 10025                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10026                                  
 10027                                  cmos_popf:				
 10028 00002917 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
 10029                                  					; return far and restore flags
 10030

 10036                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10037                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 10038                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10039                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
 10040                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10041                                  
 10042                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10043                                  ;
 10044                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
 10045                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
 10046                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
 10047                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
 10048                                  
 10049                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10050                                  
 10051                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
 10052                                  ;
 10053                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
 10054                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
 10055                                  ;  es:di = load location
 10056                                  
 10057                                  ; 17/10/2022
 10058                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10059                                  ; 09/12/2022
 10060                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
 10061                                  
 10062                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10063                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 10064                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2DC4h)
 10065                                  
 10066                                  		; si:bx = (32 bit) cluster to read
 10067                                  		; cx = sectors per cluster
 10068                                  		; es:di = load location
 10069                                  
 10070                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10071                                  getclus:
 10072                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10073                                  		; ds = cs
 10074                                  		
 10075                                  		push	cx ; 1*
 10076                                  		push	di ; 2*
 10077                                  		;mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
 10078                                  		mov	[doscnt], cx ; 12/12/2023
 10079                                  
 10080                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10081                                  		;;mov	[cs:ClusterH], si ; high word of cluster number
 10082                                  		;mov	[ClusterH], si ; high word of cluster number
 10083                                  		mov	bp, si
 10084                                  
 10085                                  		mov	ax, bx
 10086                                  
 10087                                  		;dec	ax
 10088                                  		;dec	ax
 10089                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10090                                  		sub	ax, 2
 10091                                  
 10092                                  		;;sbb	[cs:ClusterH], 0
 10093                                  		;sbb	[ClusterH], 0
 10094                                  		sbb	bp, 0		
 10095                                  
 10096                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10097                                  		;;xchg	ax, [cs:ClusterH]
 10098                                  		;xchg	ax, [ClusterH]
 10099                                  		xchg	ax, bp
 10100                                  
 10101                                  		mul	cx
 10102                                  
 10103                                  		;;xchg	ax, [cs:ClusterH]
 10104                                  		;xchg	ax, [ClusterH]
 10105                                  		xchg	ax, bp ; (+)
 10106                                  		;
 10107                                  		mul	cx		;; convert to logical sector
 10108                                  					;; dx:ax = matching logical sector number
 10109                                  					;;	  starting from the data sector
 10110                                  		;;add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
 10111                                  		;;adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
 10112                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10113                                  		;add	ax, [bios_l]
 10114                                  		;adc	dx, [bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
 10115                                  
 10116                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10117                                  		;;add	dx, [cs:ClusterH]
 10118                                  		;add	ax, [cs:First_Data_Sector]
 10119                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:First_Data_Sector+2]
 10120                                  		add	dx, bp ; (+)
 10121                                  		;add	dx, [ClusterH]	; convert to logical sector
 10122                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
 10123                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
 10124                                  		add	ax, [First_Data_Sector]
 10125                                  		adc	dx, [First_Data_Sector+2]
 10126                                  					; dx:ax = first logical sector to read
 10127                                  unpack:
 10128                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10129                                  		push	ds ; 3* ; ds = cs ; 12/12/2023
 10130                                  		push	dx ; 4* ; * ; 12/12/2023
 10131                                  		push	ax ; 5*
 10132                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10133                                  		push	si ; 6* 
 10134                                  		push	bx ; 7*
 10135                                  
 10136                                  		;;mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
 10137                                  		;mov	si, [fatloc] ; 12/12/2023
 10138                                  		;mov	ds, si
 10139                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10140                                  		;mov	ax, [fatloc]
 10141                                  		;mov	ds, ax
 10142                                  		push	bx ; 8*
 10143                                  		push	word [fatloc] ; 9*
 10144                                  
 10145                                  		;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 20h
 10146                                  		test	byte [fbigfat], 20h	; fbigbig FAT32 ?
 10147                                  		pop	ds ; 9* ; ds = [fatloc]
 10148                                  		jz      short not_32bit_cluster ; no
 10149                                  unpack32:
 10150                                  		;push	dx
 10151                                  		mov	dx, si
 10152                                  		;mov	si, bx
 10153                                  		pop	si ; 8* ; si = bx
 10154                                  		add	si, si
 10155                                  		adc	dx, dx
 10156                                  		add	si, si
 10157                                  		adc	dx, dx 
 10158                                  			; dx:si = 4*(si:bx) ; clust num offset from FAT entry 0
 10159                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10160                                  		mov	si, [bx+2]	; high word of the FAT32 cluster number
 10161                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	; low word of the FAT32 cluster number
 10162                                  		;pop	dx
 10163                                  		jmp	short getcl1
 10164                                  
 10165                                  not_32bit_cluster:
 10166                                  		;mov	si, bx		; next cluster
 10167                                  		pop	si ; 8* ; si = bx
 10168                                  		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
 10169                                  					; 16 bit fat?
 10170                                  		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
 10171                                  unpack12:
 10172                                  		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si = si/2
 10173                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
 10174                                  		add	si, bx		;
 10175                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
 10176                                  		;push	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10177                                  		xor	dx, dx
 10178                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10179                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10180                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10181                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10182                                  
 10183                                  		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
 10184                                  		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
 10185                                  		; 25/06/2023
 10186                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
 10187                                  		
 10188                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10189                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
 10190                                  		push	ax ; **	; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
 10191                                  
 10192                                   		inc	si		; (next	byte)
 10193                                  
 10194                                  		;push	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10195                                  		xor	dx, dx
 10196                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10197                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10198                                  
 10199                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
 10200                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10201                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10202                                  		;mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
 10203                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
 10204                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
 10205                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10206                                  		;mov	al, [cs:temp_cluster]
 10207                                  		pop	ax  ; ** ; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
 10208                                  		mov	ah, [0] ; high 4 bits (bits 7 to 11) of 12 bits cluster num
 10209                                  even_odd:
 10210                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10211                                  		pop	bx ; 7*		; restore old fat entry	value
 10212                                  		push	bx		; save it right	away.
 10213                                  		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
 10214                                  		jnc	short havclus	; it was even.
 10215                                  		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
 10216                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
 10217                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10218                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10219                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10220                                  havclus:
 10221                                  		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
 10222                                  		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
 10223                                  		jmp	short unpackx
 10224                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10225                                  
 10226                                  unpack16:
 10227                                  		;push	dx	; 12/12/2023
 10228                                  		xor	dx, dx ; 0
 10229                                  		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
 10230                                  		;adc	dx, 0
 10231                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10232                                  		rcl	dx, 1
 10233                                  
 10234                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10235                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10236                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10237                                  		;pop	dx	; 12/12/2023
 10238                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	;
 10239                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
 10240                                  unpackx:
 10241                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10242                                  		xor	si, si		; high word of cluster number = 0
 10243                                  					; (FAT12 or FAT16)
 10244                                  getcl1:
 10245                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10246                                  		pop	ax	; 7* - cluster number lw
 10247                                  		;pop	word [cs:ClusterH]
 10248                                  		pop	dx	; 6* - cluster number hw
 10249                                  
 10250                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 10251                                  		; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
 10252                                  		; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
 10253                                  
 10254                                  		sub	ax, bx	; previous - current (or current - new)	
 10255                                  		;sbb	[cs:ClusterH], si
 10256                                  		sbb	dx, si
 10257                                  		;;cmp	[cs:ClusterH], -1 ; one apart? (current = previous+1)
 10258                                  		;cmp	dx, -1
 10259                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10260                                  		inc	dx ; -1 -> 0
 10261                                  		jnz	short not_consequental
 10262                                  		;cmp	ax, -1		; 0FFFFh ; is [ClusterH]:ax = -1 ?
 10263                                  		inc	ax ; -1 -> 0
 10264                                  not_consequental:
 10265                                  		pop	ax ; 5* 	; restore logical sector (low)
 10266                                  		pop	dx ; 4* ; * ; 12/12/2023
 10267                                  		pop	ds ; 3*
 10268                                  
 10269                                  		;; 12/12/2023
 10270                                  		;; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
 10271                                  		;; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
 10272                                  		;; ds = cs
 10273                                  		;sub	si, bx
 10274                                  		;cmp	si, -1		; one apart? (consequtive?)
 10275                                  		;			; (current = previous+1)
 10276                                  
 10277                                  		jnz	short getcl2	; no, read [doscnt] sectors 
 10278                                  
 10279                                  		;add	[cs:doscnt], cx ; (cx = sectors per cluster)
 10280                                  		add	[doscnt], cx ; 12/12/2023 ; add to read count
 10281                                  		jmp	unpack
 10282                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10283                                  
 10284                                  getcl2:
 10285                                  		push	si ; 20/12/2023
 10286                                  		push	bx	
 10287                                  		; bx = low word of the new cluster number
 10288                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (32 bit cluster numbers)
 10289                                  		; si = high word of the new cluster number
 10290                                  		push	dx		; sector to read (high word)
 10291                                  		push	ax		; sector to read (low word)
 10292                                  		
 10293                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10294                                  		; ds = cs
 10295                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
 10296                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
 10297                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
 10298                                  
 10299                                  		;;;
 10300                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 10301                                  		;
 10302                                  		; dma and segment (64K boundary) overrun precaution
 10303                                  		; (sector count will be decreased if it is required)
 10304                                   		mov	cx, di
 10305                                  		not	cx		; cx = 65535 - cx
 10306                                  		shr	cx, 1		; cx = cx/2
 10307                                  		xor	cl, cl
 10308                                  		xchg	cl, ch		; cx = cx/256
 10309                                  		
 10310                                  		;cmp	cx, [cs:doscnt]	
 10311                                  				; if sector read count > cx, decrease it to cx
 10312                                  		cmp	cx, [doscnt]
 10313                                  		jbe	short getcl3
 10314                                  		;;;
 10315                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
 10316                                  		mov	cx, [doscnt]
 10317                                  getcl3:
 10318                                  		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
 10319                                  		;pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
 10320                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10321                                  		pop	word [start_sec_h]
 10322                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
 10323                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10324                                  		; ds = cs
 10325                                  		;push	ds
 10326                                  		;push	cs
 10327                                  		;pop	ds
 10328                                  		
 10329                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10330                                  
 10331                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10332                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10333                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; offset diskrd
 10334                                  		;mov	bp, 0A2Bh	; 20/12/2023
 10335                                  		;	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0A2Bh ; 364h:0A2Bh)
 10336                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; 17/10/2022
 10337                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
 10338                                  
 10339                                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
 10340                                  		
 10341                                  		;pop	ds
 10342                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10343                                  		; ds = cs
 10344                                  		pop	bx		; lw of the new cluster number
 10345                                  		pop	si ; 20/12/2023 ; hw of the new cluster number
 10346                                  
 10347                                  		pop	di ; 2* - (kernel) load location (es:di)
 10348                                  
 10349                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
 10350                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10351                                  		mov	ax, [doscnt]
 10352                                  		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
 10353                                  		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
 10354                                  		add	di, ax		; update load location
 10355                                  
 10356                                  		pop	cx ; 1*		; restore sectors/cluster
 10357                                  
 10358                                  		retn
 10359                                  
 10360                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10361                                  
 10362                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
 10363                                  ;
 10364                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
 10365                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
 10366                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
 10367                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
 10368                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
 10369                                  ;
 10370                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
 10371                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
 10372                                  ;      other registers are saved.
 10373                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
 10374                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
 10375                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
 10376                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
 10377                                  
 10378                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10379                                  get_fat_sector:	
 10380                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10381                                  		; ds = fat buffer segment
 10382                                  
 10383                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10384                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
 10385                                  		push	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
 10386                                  		push	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
 10387                                  		push	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
 10388                                  		push	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
 10389                                  		push	ds ; FAT buffer segment
 10390                                  
 10391                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10392                                  		push	cs
 10393                                  		pop	ds
 10394                                  	
 10395                                  		mov	ax, si
 10396                                  		;;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10397                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10398                                  		;mov	cx, [md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10399                                  		;div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
 10400                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10401                                  		;nop
 10402                                  
 10403                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10404                                  		div	word [md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10405                                  
 10406                                  		; ax = FAT sector (sequence/index) number
 10407                                  		; dx = cluster number offset
 10408                                  
 10409                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
 10410                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
 10411                                  
 10412                                  		; 12/12/2023 ; *
 10413                                  		;push	es ; *
 10414                                  		;push	ds ; *
 10415                                  		;push	di ; *
 10416                                  		push	ax
 10417                                  		;push	cs ; *
 10418                                  		;pop	ds ; *
 10419                                  
 10420                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
 10421                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10422                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id 
 10423                                  		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
 10424                                  		;mov	bp, 5AEh  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 10425                                  		;;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
 10426                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
 10427                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10428                                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
 10429                                  		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
 10430                                  		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
 10431                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
 10432                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10433                                  		;pop	di ; *
 10434                                  		;pop	ds ; *
 10435                                  		;pop	es ; *
 10436                                  
 10437                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10438                                  		; ds = cs
 10439                                  		cmp	ax, [last_fat_sec_num]
 10440                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
 10441                                  		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
 10442                                  		mov	[last_fat_sec_num], ax
 10443                                  		;mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax
 10444                                  					; sector number
 10445                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
 10446                                  		; 13/12/2023
 10447                                  		pop	es ; FAT buffer segment (DS on top of the stack)
 10448                                  		push	es ; (put it on top of the stack again)
 10449                                  
 10450                                  		push	dx ; cluster number offset
 10451                                  
 10452                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10453                                  		xor	cx, cx
 10454                                  		mov	[start_sec_h], cx ;0 
 10455                                  		;mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
 10456                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
 10457                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
 10458                                  		mov	dx, ax
 10459                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10460                                  		inc	cx ; cx = 1
 10461                                  		;mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
 10462                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
 10463                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]
 10464                                  		;push	ds
 10465                                  		;pop	es
 10466                                  
 10467                                  		xor	di, di	; 0	; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
 10468                                  		
 10469                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10470                                  		;push	ds
 10471                                  		;push	cs
 10472                                  		;pop	ds
 10473                                  		
 10474                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10475                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
 10476                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
 10477                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
 10478                                  		call	call_bios_code
 10479                                  
 10480                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10481                                  		;pop	ds
 10482                                  		; ds = cs = biosdata segment
 10483                                  
 10484                                  		pop	dx ; cluster number offset 
 10485                                  
 10486                                  gfs_split_chk:
 10487                                  		; 13/12/2023
 10488                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10489                                  		mov	cx, [md_sectorsize]
 10490                                  ;gfs_split_chk:					
 10491                                  		dec	cx		; 511
 10492                                  		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
 10493                                  					; last byte of this sector,
 10494                                  					; then splitted	entry.
 10495                                  		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
 10496                                  		
 10497                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10498                                  		; bx = dx = cluster number offset in the FAT buffer
 10499                                  		pop	ds ; FAT buffer segment
 10500                                  		pop	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
 10501                                  		pop	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
 10502                                  		pop	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
 10503                                  		pop	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
 10504                                  		;pop	ax
 10505                                  
 10506                                  		retn
 10507                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10508                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
 10509                                  
 10510                                  %endif
 10511                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10512                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10513                                  
 10514                                  		; 09/12/2022
 10515                                  		;db 0
 10516                                  
 10517                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
 10518                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
 10519                                  
 10520                                  %if (numbertomod>0) & (numbertomod<16) ; 17/09/2023
 10521 00002918 00<rep 8h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
 10522                                  %endif
