 11700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 11701                                  ;								:
 11702                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
 11703                                  ;								:
 11704                                  ;								:
 11705                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
 11706                                  ;								:
 11707                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
 11708                                  ;								:
 11709                                  ;	routine 		function			:
 11710                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
 11711                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
 11712                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
 11713                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
 11714                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
 11715                                  ;								:
 11716                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
 11717                                  ;								:
 11718                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
 11719                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
 11720                                  ;								:
 11721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 11722                                  
 11723                                  ; convert time to ticks
 11724                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
 11725                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
 11726                                  
 11727                                  ;19/07/2019
 11728                                  ;09/03/2019
 11729                                  
 11730                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
 11731                                  
 11732                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
 11733                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
 11734                                  
 11735 000003A0 B03C                    		mov	al, 60
 11736 000003A2 F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
 11737 000003A4 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 11738 000003A6 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
 11739 000003A8 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
 11740 000003AB 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
 11741 000003AD F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
 11742 000003AF 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
 11743 000003B1 B064                    		mov	al, 100
 11744 000003B3 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
 11745 000003B5 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
 11746 000003B7 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
 11747 000003BA B700                    		mov	bh, 0
 11748 000003BC 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
 11749 000003BE 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 11750                                  
 11751                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
 11752                                  
 11753 000003C1 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 11754 000003C2 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
 11755 000003C3 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
 11756 000003C6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
 11757 000003C8 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
 11758 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
 11759 000003CB F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
 11760 000003CD 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
 11761 000003CF 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 11762 000003D2 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
 11763 000003D3 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
 11764 000003D6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
 11765 000003D8 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
 11766 000003DA B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 11767 000003DC 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
 11768 000003DE 98                      		cbw
 11769 000003DF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
 11770 000003E0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
 11771 000003E2 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
 11772 000003E4 CB                      		retf			; far return
 11773                                  
 11774                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11775

 11777                                  ; 15/10/2022

 11779                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 11780                                  ;
 11781                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
 11782                                  ;
 11783                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
 11784                                  ;
 11785                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
 11786                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
 11787                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
 11788                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
 11789                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
 11790                                  ;
 11791                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
 11792                                  ;
 11793                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 11794                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 11795                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 11796                                  ;
 11797                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 11798                                  
 11799                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 11800                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
 11801                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh

 11803 000003E8 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
 11804                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
 11805 000003E9 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 11806                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 11807 000003EE 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
 11808 000003F0 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
 11809                                  					; get binary hours
 11810                                  					; convert to bcd
 11811                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11812                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
 11813                                  		; 08/08/2023

 11815 000003F7 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
 11816 000003F9 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
 11817                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11818                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
 11819 000003FD E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
 11820 00000400 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
 11821 00000402 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
 11822                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11823                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
 11824 00000406 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
 11825                                  
 11826 00000409 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
 11827 0000040B B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
 11828 0000040D FA                      		cli
 11829 0000040E B403                    		mov	ah, 3
 11830 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 11831                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
 11832                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
 11833                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 11834 00000412 FB                      		sti
 11835                                  no_cmos_1:				
 11836 00000413 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
 11837 00000417 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
 11838                                  		; 17/10/2022
 11839 0000041B FF1E[0606]              		call	far [ttticks]
 11840                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
 11841                                  					; convert time to ticks
 11842                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
 11843 0000041F FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
 11844 00000420 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 11845 00000422 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
 11846                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
 11847                                  					; Return: time of day set
 11848                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
 11849 00000424 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt]
 11850 00000428 FB                      		sti
 11851                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 11852 00000429 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 11853 0000042E 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
 11854                                  
 11855                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11856                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
 11857                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
 11858                                  					; convert to bcd format
 11859 00000430 E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
 11860                                  
 11861 00000433 FA                      		cli
 11862 00000434 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
 11863 00000436 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 11864                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
 11865                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
 11866                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 11867 00000438 FB                      		sti
 11868                                  no_cmos_2:
 11869                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11870                                  		; cf=0
 11871                                  		;clc
 11872 00000439 C3                      		retn

 11876                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)

 11878                                  %if 1

 11880                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
 11881                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
 11882                                  
 11883                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
 11884                                  
 11885                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
 11886                                  ;
 11887                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
 11888                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
 11889                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
 11890                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
 11891                                  
 11892                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11893                                  
 11894                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
 11895                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
 11896 0000043A FF36[8904]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
 11897 0000043E 813E[8904]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 11898                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
 11899 00000444 7308                    		jnb	short century20
 11900                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
 11901                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
 11902                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11903 00000446 C706[8D04]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
 11904 0000044C EB0C                    		jmp	short years
 11905                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11906                                  		
 11907                                  century20:				
 11908                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
 11909                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
 11910                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11911 0000044E C706[8D04]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
 11912 00000454 812E[8904]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 11913                                  					; adjust daycnt
 11914                                  years:					
 11915 0000045A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 11916 0000045C A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 11917 0000045F BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
 11918                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
 11919 00000462 F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
 11920 00000464 8916[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
 11921 00000468 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
 11922 0000046A F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
 11923 0000046C 0006[8E04]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
 11924 00000470 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
 11925                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11926 00000474 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
 11927 00000477 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
 11928                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
 11929 0000047A 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
 11930 0000047E 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
 11931 00000480 FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
 11932                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
 11933 00000484 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
 11934                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
 11935                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11936 00000488 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365
 11937                                  regularyear:	; 20/12/2023
 11938                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
 11939 00000489 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 11940 0000048D 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
 11941 0000048F FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
 11942                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
 11943 00000493 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 11944 00000497 E2F0                    		loop	regularyear	; }
 11945                                  					;
 11946                                  					; should never fall through loop
 11947                                  leapyear:	
 11948 00000499 C606[9004]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
 11949                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
 11950                                  					; change month table.
 11951                                  yeardone:				
 11952 0000049E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
 11953 000004A0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 11954 000004A2 A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 11955                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
 11956 000004A5 BE[8F04]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
 11957                                  		;mov	cx, 12
 11958                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11959 000004A8 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
 11960                                  months:					
 11961 000004AA FEC3                    		inc	bl
 11962                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11963 000004AC 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
 11964 000004AE 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
 11965                                  					; dh=0

 11968 000004B3 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt

 11971                                  month_done:	
 11972 000004B7 C606[9004]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
 11973                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
 11974                                  					; restore month table value
 11975 000004BC 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
 11976 000004BE 8A36[8E04]              		mov	dh, [base_year]

 11978 000004C6 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
 11979                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
 11980 000004C9 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
 11981 000004CB E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
 11982 000004CE 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
 11983 000004D0 E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century

 11988 000004DE C3                      		retn

 11990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11991                                  
 11992                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
 11993                                  
 11994                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
 11995                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
 11996                                  		
 11997 000004DF D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
 11998 000004E1 D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
 11999                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
 12000 000004E3 C3                      		retn

 12003                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12004                                  
 12005                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12006                                  
 12007                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12008                                  ; gettime reads date and time
 12009                                  ; and returns the following information:
 12010                                  ;
 12011                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
 12012                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
 12013                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
 12014                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
 12015                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
 12016                                  ;
 12017                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 12018                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 12019                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 12020                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12021                                  
 12022                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
 12023 000004E4 E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
 12024 000004E7 8B36[8904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
 12025                                  
 12026                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
 12027                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
 12028                                  ;
 12029                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
 12030                                  ;	       ----------------
 12031                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
 12032                                  ;
 12033                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
 12034                                  ;
 12035                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
 12036                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 12037                                  ;		1,193,180
 12038                                  ;
 12039                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
 12040                                  ;
 12041                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
 12042                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 12043                                  ;		59,659
 12044                                  ;
 12045                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
 12046                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
 12047                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
 12048                                  ;
 12049                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
 12050                                  ; multiply by 5
 12051                                  
 12052 000004EB 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 12053 000004ED 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
 12054                                  					; multiply by 5
 12055 000004EF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 12056 000004F1 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
 12057 000004F3 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 12058 000004F5 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
 12059 000004F7 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
 12060 000004F9 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
 12061 000004FB 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 12062                                  
 12063                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
 12064                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
 12065                                  
 12066 000004FC B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
 12067 000004FF F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
 12068                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
 12069                                  
 12070                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 12071                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
 12072 00000501 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
 12073 00000502 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
 12074 00000504 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
 12075                                  
 12076                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
 12077                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
 12078                                  
 12079 00000506 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
 12080 00000508 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
 12081                                  
 12082                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
 12083                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
 12084                                  
 12085 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
 12086 0000050D 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
 12087 00000510 7203                    		jb	short noadj
 12088 00000512 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
 12089                                  noadj:					
 12090 00000515 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
 12091 00000516 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
 12092                                  
 12093                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
 12094                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
 12095                                  
 12096 00000518 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
 12097 0000051A B200                    		mov	dl, 0
 12098 0000051C D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
 12099                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
 12100                                  		; 20/12/2023
 12101 0000051E B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
 12102 00000520 F7F1                    		div	cx
 12103 00000522 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
 12104 00000524 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
 12105 00000526 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
 12106                                  
 12107                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
 12108                                  
 12109                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12110                                  		;push	ax
 12111                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
 12112 00000528 96                      		xchg	ax, si
 12113 00000529 AB                      		stosw
 12114                                  		;pop	ax
 12115 0000052A 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
 12116 0000052B AB                      		stosw
 12117 0000052C 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
 12118 0000052E AB                      		stosw
 12119 0000052F F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
 12120                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
 12121                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
 12122                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
 12123                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
 12124 00000530 C3                      		retn
 12125                                  
 12126                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12127                                  
 12128                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12129                                  
 12130                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12131                                  ;
 12132                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
 12133                                  ;
 12134                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
 12135                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
 12136                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
 12137                                  ;
 12138                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
 12139                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
 12140                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
 12141                                  ;			else
 12142                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
 12143                                  ;		}
 12144                                  ;
 12145                                  ; USES : AX
 12146                                  ;
 12147                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
 12148                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
 12149                                  ;
 12150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12151                                  
 12152                                  		; 17/10/2022
 12153                                  GetTickCnt:
 12154 00000531 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 12155 00000533 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
 12156                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
 12157                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
 12158                                  					; midnight
 12159                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
 12160                                  		; 20/12/2023
 12161 00000535 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 12162 00000537 3826[8B04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
 12163                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
 12164 0000053B 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
 12165                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
 12166                                  					; and not flag
 12167 0000053D 0106[8904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
 12168 00000541 C3                      		retn
 12169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12170                                  
 12171                                  inc_case:
 12172 00000542 08C0                    		or	al, al
 12173 00000544 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
 12174 00000546 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
 12175                                  no_rollover:
 12176 0000054A C3                      		retn
 12177

 12219                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 12220                                  ;	disk interface routines
 12221                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 12222                                  
 12223                                  ; device attribute bits:
 12224                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 12225                                  
 12226                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 12227                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 12228                                  
 12229                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 12230                                  
 12231                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 12232                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 12233                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 12234                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 12235                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 12236                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 12237                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 12238                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 12239                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 12240                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 12241                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 12242                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 12243                                  ; we reset the counter.
 12244                                  
 12245                                  accessmax	equ	5
 12246                                  
 12247                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 12248                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 12249                                  ;
 12250                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 12251                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 12252                                  ;	set slow = 15
 12253                                  ;   else
 12254                                  ;	set slow = value
 12255                                  ;   ...
 12256                                  ;*********************************************
 12257                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 12258                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 12259                                  ;*	 use slow
 12260                                  ;*   else
 12261                                  ;*	 use fast
 12262                                  ;*********************************************
 12263                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 12264                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 12265                                  ;	use slow
 12266                                  ;   else
 12267                                  ;	use fast
 12268                                  ;   ...
 12269                                  ;   restore current head settle value
 12270                                  ;
 12271                                  ;
 12272                                  ;---------------------------------------
 12273                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
 12274                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 12275                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
 12276                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
 12277                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
 12278                                  
 12279                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
 12280                                  
 12281                                  ; 15/10/2022

 12366                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12367                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 12368                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 12369                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 12370                                  ;
 12371                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.

 12374                                  SetDrive:
 12375                                  		;les	di, dword ptr ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds

 12377                                  X_Scan_Loop:
 12378 000005A8 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 12379 000005AC 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 12380 000005AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 12381 000005B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 12382 000005B4 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop

 12391                                  	; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
 12392                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05C2h
 12393                                  
 12394                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 12395                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 12396                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 12397                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 12398                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 12399                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 12400                                  
 12401                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 12402 000005B8 E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 12403 000005BB BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 12404                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12405 000005BE 26F6454001              		test	byte [es:di+40h], 1
 12406                                  		;test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 12407                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 12408 000005C3 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 12409                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12410 000005C5 26806540FE              		and	byte [es:di+40h], 0FEh
 12411                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12412                                  		;and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
 12413                                  		;;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12414                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
 12415 000005CA C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 12416                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
 12417                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12418 000005CF 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1

 12420                                  					; fnon_removable
 12421 000005D4 740B                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
 12422                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
 12423                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12424 000005D6 F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
 12425 000005D8 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
 12426                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12427                                  
 12428                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
 12429                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12430 000005DA 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 12431                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
 12432                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 12433 000005DF 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 12434                                  wehaveafloppy:
 12435                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
 12436                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12437 000005E1 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
 12438                                  
 12439                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 12440                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 12441                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
 12442                                  
 12443 000005E2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?

 12445 000005E9 E83615                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
 12446 000005EC 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj

 12448 000005F1 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 12449                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:

 12451                                  			
 12452 000005F3 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change

 12454 000005F9 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12455                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
 12456 000005FD 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
 12457 000005FF E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
 12458 00000602 EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
 12459                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12460

 12463

 12465                                  		; Clean up the left overs

 12471 0000060E 07                      		pop	es
 12472 0000060F 09F6                    		or	si, si
 12473 00000611 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
 12474 00000613 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 12475 00000618 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
 12476 0000061A E80016                  		call	media_set_vid
 12477                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:

 12479                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
 12480                                  ret_carry_clear:

 12483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12484                                  
 12485                                  err_exitj:
 12486 00000624 E88207                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
 12487                                  ret81:

 12489 00000629 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
 12490                                  
 12491                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12492                                  
 12493                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12494                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 12495                                  ; drive.
 12496                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 12497                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 12498                                  ; returns in si:
 12499                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 12500                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 12501                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 12502                                  ;
 12503                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 12504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12505                                  
 12506                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IBMBIO.COM
 12507                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12508                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 12509 0000062A BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 12510 0000062D E801FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 12511                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12512 00000630 268B4579                		mov	ax, [es:di+79h]
 12513                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 12514                                  					; get stored time
 12515 00000634 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 12516                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12517 00000636 268B457B                		mov	ax, [es:di+7Bh]
 12518                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 12519 0000063A 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 12520                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12521                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 12522                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 12523 0000063C 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 12524 0000063E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 12525 00000640 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 12526                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12527                                  		;inc	al
 12528                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 12529                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 12530                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5
 12531                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 12532                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 12533                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 12534                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12535                                  		;dec	al
 12536                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 12537                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12538 00000642 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 12539 00000647 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 12540 00000649 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 12541 0000064D C3                      		retn
 12542                                  
 12543                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12544                                  
 12545                                  timepassed:
 12546 0000064E 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 12547                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 12548 00000651 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 12549                                  
 12550                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.

 12730                                  			; purpose: test byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbigbig
 12731                                  			; applied: test byte [es:BDS.fatsiz+136], fbigbig -BUG!-
 12732                                  
 12733                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023 - Erdogan Tan)
 12734                                  			;; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 12735                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 12736                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 12737                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 12738                                  			; at the BDS offset 59 but current (this) code checks flags
 12739                                  			; at ES:DI+59 while DI points the BDS offset 136!? ; (PCDOS 7.1)
 12740                                  			;; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 12741                                  			;; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!? ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 12742                                  			;
 12743                                  			; Correct Code:
 12744                                  			; ;test byte [ES:59],20h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbigbig  ; (PCDOS 7.1)	
 12745                                  			; ;;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig  ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 12746                                  			; 11/09/2023
 12747                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 12748                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 12749                                  			;
 12750                                  			; Same BUG is existing in MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh
 12751                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 12752                                  
 12753                                  			;
 12754                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 12755                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 12756                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 12757                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 12758

 12805                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12806                                  
 12807                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12808                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 12809                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 12810                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 12811                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 12812                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 12813                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 12814                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 12815                                  ;
 12816                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 12817                                  ;
 12818                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 12819                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 12820                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 12821                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 12822                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 12823                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 12824                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 12825                                  ;
 12826                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 12827                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 12828                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 12829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12830                                  
 12831                                  		; 29/12/2023
 12832                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
 12833                                  GetBp:
 12834                                  		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 12835                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12836 000006D6 26F6453F05              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 5 ; PCDOS 7.1
 12837                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 12838                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 5 ; MSDOS 6.22 (& MSDOS 5.0)
 12839                                  		;jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 12840                                  		;jmp	getret_exit
 12841                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12842 000006DB 75F8                    		jnz	short getret_exit
 12843                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12844                                  getbp1:	
 12845 000006DD 51                      		push	cx
 12846 000006DE 52                      		push	dx
 12847 000006DF 53                      		push	bx
 12848                                  
 12849                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
 12850                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
 12851                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
 12852                                  
 12853 000006E0 E8CF00                  		call	readbootsec
 12854 000006E3 720A                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
 12855 000006E5 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
 12856 000006E7 7509                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
 12857 000006E9 E81401                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
 12858                                  		;jmp	short Has1
 12859                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) IBMBIO.COM
 12860 000006EC E9B500                  		jmp	getret
 12861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12862                                  
 12863                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:
 12864 000006EF E9B600                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
 12865                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12866                                  
 12867                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
 12868                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
 12869                                  dofatbpb:				
 12870 000006F2 E8B401                  		call	readfat		; puts media descriptor	byte in	ah
 12871 000006F5 72F8                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg

 12873 000006F7 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; 19/10/2022

 12876                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

 12880                                  		;cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 12881                                  					; ffSmall

 12884 0000070B 7512                    		jnz	short got_unknown_medium

 12886                                  		; 21/12/2023

 13063                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13064                                  
 13065                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13066                                  
 13067                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 13068                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 13069                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 13070                                  ;
 13071                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 13072                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 13073                                  
 13074                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13075                                  
 13076                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 13077                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 13078                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)) ; 22/12/2023
 13079                                  
 13080                                  ; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13081                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:07C6h)
 13082                                  
 13083                                  readbootsec:	
 13084 000007B2 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 13085 000007B4 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 13086 000007B7 E8FC00                  		call	read_sector
 13087 000007BA 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 13088 000007BC 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 13089                                  
 13090                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 13091                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 13092                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 13093                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 13094                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 13095                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 13096                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 13097                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 13098                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 13099                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 13100                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 13101                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 13102                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 13103                                  		; informations
 13104                                  
 13105                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 13106                                  
 13107                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13108                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13109                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 13110                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 13111                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 13112                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 13113                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 13114                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13115                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 13116                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13117                                  
 13118                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13119 000007BE A0[5201]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 13120 000007C1 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 13121 000007C3 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 13122                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 13123 000007C5 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 13124 000007C7 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 13125                                  					; no need for nop
 13126 000007C9 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 13127 000007CB 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 13128 000007CD 803E[5401]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 13129 000007D2 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 13130                                  
 13131                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13132                                  ;
 13133                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 13134                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 13135                                  ;;
 13136                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 13137                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 13138                                  ;;
 13139                                  ;;check_signature:
 13140                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 13141                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 13142                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 13143                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 13144                                  
 13145                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 13146                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 13147                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 13148                                  
 13149                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13150                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 13151 000007D4 A0[6701]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 13152                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13153 000007D7 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 13154 000007D8 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 13155 000007DA 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 13156 000007DC 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 13157 000007DD 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13158                                  
 13159                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 13160                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 13161                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 13162                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 13163                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 13164                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 13165                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 13166                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 13167                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 13168                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 13169                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 13170                                  
 13171                                  checksinglesided:
 13172                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 13173                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13174                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 13175 000007DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 13176 000007E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 13177 000007E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
 13178 000007E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 13179 000007E7 813E[5A01]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 13180 000007ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 13181 000007EF 803E[5C01]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 13182 000007F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 13183                                  
 13184                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 13185                                  
 13186                                  mustbeearlier:				
 13187 000007F6 C606[5F01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 13188                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 13189 000007FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 13190                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13191                                  
 13192                                  invalidbootsec:				
 13193 000007FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 13194                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13195                                  movbpb_ret:
 13196                                  gooddsk:				
 13197 000007FE F8                      		clc
 13198                                  err_ret:
 13199 000007FF C3                      		retn

 13206                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13207                                  
 13208                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13209                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13210                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 13211                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 13212                                  ;
 13213                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 13214                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 13215                                  ; the boot record. after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 13216                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 13217                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 13218                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 13219                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13220                                  
 13221                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13222                                  
 13223                                  ; 22/12/2023
 13224                                  %if 0
 13225                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13226                                  movbpb:
 13227                                  		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 13228                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 13229                                  					; sectors per unit
 13230                                  		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 13231                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 13232                                  					; number of directory entries
 13233                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 13234                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 13235                                  					; size of drive
 13236                                  		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 13237                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13238                                  					; media	descriptor
 13239                                  		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 13240                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 13241                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 13242                                  		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 13243                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 13244                                  					; sectors per track
 13245                                  		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 13246                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 13247                                  					; number of heads
 13248                                  %else
 13249                                  		; 29/12/2023
 13250                                  		; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13251                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:0814h)
 13252                                  		;;;
 13253                                  movbpb:
 13254 00000800 57                      		push	di
 13255 00000801 83C706                  		add	di, 6		; BDS+6 = BDS.BPB
 13256 00000804 8D36[5D01]              		lea	si, [disksector+0Bh]
 13257 00000808 B93500                  		mov	cx, 53		; copy bios parameters block
 13258                                  					; from BPB_BytsPerSec to (FAT32) BS_DrvNum (excluded)
 13259 0000080B FC                      		cld
 13260 0000080C F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13261 0000080E 8B4CD3                  		mov	cx, [si-45]	; si = disksector+64 -> 64-45 = 19
 13262                                  					; disksektor+19 = BPB_TotSec16
 13263 00000811 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
 13264 00000813 E308                    		jcxz	movbpb_bigdisk
 13265 00000815 26894DE0                		mov	[es:di-32], cx	; write 16 bit total sectors
 13266                                  					; to 32 bit total sectors field
 13267 00000819 268945E2                		mov	[es:di-30], ax	; BPB_TotalSec32+2 (BDS offset 29, BPB offset 23)
 13268                                  movbpb_bigdisk:
 13269 0000081D 3944D6                  		cmp	[si-42], ax     ; BPB_FATSz16 = disksector+22
 13270 00000820 7410                    		jz	short movbpb_fat32
 13271                                  movbpb_fat:
 13272 00000822 83EF1C                  		sub	di, 28		; di = BDS offset 31 (BPB offset 25)
 13273                                  		; 29/12/2023
 13274 00000825 B90C00                  		mov	cx, 12		; clear 12 byte extended BDS (FAT32) fields
 13275                                  					; (which are used only for FAT32 disks)
 13276 00000828 F3AA                    		rep stosb
 13277 0000082A 48                      		dec	ax		; -1 ; 0FFFFh
 13278 0000082B AB                      		stosw			; set BDS offset 43 (dword) to -1
 13279                                  					; dword [BDS.BPB_FSInfo] = 0FFFFFFFFh
 13280 0000082C AB                      		stosw
 13281 0000082D 40                      		inc	ax		; ax = 0
 13282 0000082E B10C                    		mov	cl, 12		
 13283                                  		;mov	cx, 12		; clear BDS offset 47 to 59
 13284                                  					; (BPB offset 41 to 53) (disksector offset 52 to 64)
 13285 00000830 F3AA                    		rep stosb
 13286                                  movbpb_fat32:
 13287 00000832 5F                      		pop	di
 13288                                  %endif
 13289                                  		;;;
 13290                                  
 13291 00000833 803E[9B04]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 13292 00000838 75C4                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 13293 0000083A E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 13294 0000083D 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 13295 0000083F C606[9B04]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 13296                                  movbpb_conv:
 13297 00000844 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 13298 00000849 75B3                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 13299 0000084B E83714                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 13300                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13301                                  		; cf = 0
 13302                                  ;movbpb_ret:
 13303                                  		;clc
 13304 0000084E C3                      		retn
 13305                                  		
 13306                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13307                                  
 13308                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 13309                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 13310                                  ;by es:di.
 13311                                  
 13312                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 13313                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 13314                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 13315                                  ;      the boot record information.
 13316                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 13317                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 13318                                  
 13319                                  ; 22/12/2023
 13320                                  %if 0
 13321                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13322                                  mov_media_ids:		
 13323                                  		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 13324                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 13325                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 13326                                  		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 13327                                  		push	cx
 13328                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 13329                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 13330                                  		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 13331                                  		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 13332                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 13333                                  		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 13334                                  		push	di
 13335                                  		push	si
 13336                                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13337                                  		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 13338                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 13339                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 13340                                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 13341                                  		rep movsb
 13342                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 13343                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13344                                  		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 13345                                  		mov	si, disksector+36h
 13346                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 13347                                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13348                                  		rep movsb
 13349                                  		pop	si
 13350                                  		pop	di
 13351                                  		pop	cx
 13352                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13353                                  		; cf = 0
 13354                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 13355                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 13356                                  		retn
 13357                                  %else
 13358                                  		; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13359                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:0865h)
 13360                                  		;;;		
 13361                                  mov_media_ids:
 13362 0000084F 833E[6801]00            		cmp	word [disksector+16h], 0 ; BPB.FATSz16

 13423                                  ; 15/10/2022
 13424                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 13425                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 13426                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 13427                                  ; output:
 13428                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
