 17583                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17584                                  
 17585                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17586                                  
 17587                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17588                                  ;
 17589                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 17590                                  ;
 17591                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 17592                                  ;							seg ffff )
 17593                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 17594                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 17595                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 17596                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 17597                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 17598                                  ;
 17599                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 17600                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 17601                                  ;
 17602                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17603                                  
 17604                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17605                                  HMAPtr:
 17606 00001727 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 17607                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 17608 0000172C 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17609                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17610 00001730 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17611 00001733 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17612 00001735 803E[DD07]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 17613                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 17614 0000173A 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17615 0000173C FF1E[D907]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17616                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17617 00001740 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17618                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17619                                  HMAPtr_retn:
 17620 00001744 C3                      		retn
 17621                                  
 17622                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17623                                  
 17624                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17625                                  
 17626                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 17627                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 17628                                  
 17629                                  move_sector:
 17630                                  
 17631                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 17632                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 17633                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 17634                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 17635                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 17636                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 17637                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 17638                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 17639                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 17640                                  ;
 17641                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 17642                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 17643                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 17644                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 17645                                  ; back to a byte move.
 17646                                  
 17647 00001745 FC                      		cld
 17648 00001746 51                      		push	cx
 17649 00001747 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 17650 0000174A 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 17651 0000174E 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17652 00001750 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 17653 00001754 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17654 00001756 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 17655 00001758 59                      		pop	cx
 17656 00001759 C3                      		retn
 17657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17658                                  
 17659                                  movsec_bytes:
 17660 0000175A D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 17661 0000175C F3A4                    		rep movsb
 17662 0000175E 59                      		pop	cx
 17663 0000175F C3                      		retn
 17664                                  
 17665                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17666                                  
 17667                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17668                                  
 17669                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 17670                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 17671                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 17672                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 17673                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 17674                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 17675                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 17676                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 17677                                  ;
 17678                                  ; input conditions:
 17679                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 17680                                  ;
 17681                                  ; output:
 17682                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 17683                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 17684                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 17685                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 17686                                  
 17687                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 17688                                  check_wrap:	
 17689 00001760 50                      		push	ax
 17690 00001761 53                      		push	bx
 17691 00001762 06                      		push	es
 17692 00001763 57                      		push	di
 17693 00001764 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 17694 00001767 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 17695                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17696 00001769 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 17697                                  		; 12/12/2022
 17698                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 17699                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 17700 0000176E 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 17701 00001770 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 17702 00001774 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 17703 00001776 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 17704 00001779 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 17705 0000177B 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 17706 0000177D F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 17707                                  
 17708                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 17709                                  ; last sector on that track.
 17710                                  
 17711 0000177F 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 17712 00001781 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 17713                                  		; 18/12/2022
 17714 00001783 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 17715 00001784 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 17716                                  					; if on	boundary
 17717                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 17718                                  not_on_bound:
 17719 00001786 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 17720 00001789 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 17721 0000178B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 17722 0000178D 40                      		inc	ax
 17723 0000178E 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 17724 00001790 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 17725                                  		; 02/09/2023
 17726 00001793 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17727 00001797 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 17728                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17729                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 17730 00001799 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 17731 0000179B 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 17732 0000179C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 17733                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17734 0000179E F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 17735                                  
 17736                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 17737                                  
 17738 000017A0 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 17739 000017A2 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 17740 000017A4 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 17741                                  
 17742                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 17743                                  
 17744 000017A6 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 17745 000017A8 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 17746 000017AA 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 17747                                  no_head_bound:				
 17748 000017AB 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 17749 000017AD 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 17750 000017AE FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 17751 000017B0 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 17752 000017B2 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 17753 000017B4 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 17754 000017B7 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 17755 000017B9 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 17756 000017BB D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 17757 000017BD 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 17758 000017BF 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 17759 000017C1 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 17760 000017C3 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 17761 000017C5 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 17762                                  no_wrap:				
 17763 000017C7 F8                      		clc
 17764 000017C8 5F                      		pop	di
 17765 000017C9 07                      		pop	es
 17766 000017CA 5B                      		pop	bx
 17767 000017CB 58                      		pop	ax
 17768 000017CC C3                      		retn
 17769                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17770                                  
 17771                                  no_wrap_head:				
 17772 000017CD 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 17773 000017CF FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 17774 000017D1 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 17775                                  
 17776                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17777                                  
 17778                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17779                                  
 17780                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 17781                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 17782                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 17783                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 17784                                  ;
 17785                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 17786                                  
 17787                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17788                                  find_bds:	
 17789 000017D3 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 17790                                  fbds_1:					
 17791 000017D7 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 17792 000017DB 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 17793 000017DD 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 17794                                  					; go to next bds
 17795 000017E0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17796 000017E3 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 17797 000017E5 F9                      		stc
 17798                                  fdbs_2:					
 17799 000017E6 C3                      		retn
 17800                                  
 17801                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17802                                  
 17803                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17804                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17805                                  doint:
 17806                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17807 000017E7 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 17808                                  					; get physical drive number
 17809                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 17810                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 17811                                  		
 17812 000017EA 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 17813 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al
 17814 000017EE 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 17815                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17816 000017F0 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 17817                                  					; get request code
 17818                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 17819 000017F3 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17820                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 17821 000017F6 9D                      		popf
 17822                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 17823                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17824 000017F7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17825                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 17826                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17827 000017FC 9C                      		pushf
 17828                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17829 000017FD 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17830                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 17831                                  dointdone:				
 17832 00001800 C3                      		retn
 17833                                  
 17834                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17835                                  
 17836                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17837                                  
 17838                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 17839                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 17840                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 17841                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 17842                                  ;
 17843                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 17844                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 17845                                  ;
 17846                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 17847                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 17848                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 17849                                  
 17850                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 17851                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 17852                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 17853                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 17854                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 17855                                  ;.olddx: resw
 17856                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 17857                                  ;.olddd: resd
 17858                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 17859                                  ;end struc
 17860                                  
 17861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17862                                  
 17863                                  ;   entry conditions:
 17864                                  ;	ah = function
 17865                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 17866                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 17867                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 17868                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 17869                                  ;   output conditions:
 17870                                  ;	no dma violation.
 17871                                  
 17872                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 17873                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 17874                                  ;
 17875                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 17876                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 17877                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 17878                                  
 17879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17880                                  
 17881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17882                                  
 17883                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17884                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1889h
 17885                                  dtype_array:
 17886 00001801 90004000                		dd 400090h		; 40h:90h is drive type array addr
 17887                                  
 17888                                  ; 17/10/2022
 17889                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 17890                                  ; 09/12/2022
 17891                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 17892                                  
 17893                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17894                                  
 17895                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 17896                                  
 17897                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 17898                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 17899                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 17900                                  
 17901                                  format_special_stuff:
 17902 00001805 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 17903 0000180A 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 17904 0000180C 53                      		push	bx
 17905 0000180D BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 17906 00001810 E85104                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 17907 00001813 5B                      		pop	bx
 17908 00001814 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 17909                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17910                                  
 17911                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17912                                  
 17913                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 17914                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 17915                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 17916                                  
 17917                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17918                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 17919 00001816 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 17920 00001818 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 17921 0000181A 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 17922 0000181B 51                      		push	cx
 17923 0000181C 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 17924 0000181E B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 17925 00001820 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 17926 00001822 8406[A204]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 17927 00001826 59                      		pop	cx
 17928 00001827 58                      		pop	ax
 17929 00001828 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17930                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 17931 0000182A 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 17932 0000182B 06                      		push	es
 17933                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17934 0000182C 2EC41E[0118]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 17935                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 17936                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 17937 00001831 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 17938 00001833 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 17939 00001836 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 17940                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 17941                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 17942 0000183A 07                      		pop	es
 17943 0000183B 5B                      		pop	bx
 17944 0000183C EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17945                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17946                                  
 17947                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17948                                  
 17949                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 17950                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 17951                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 17952                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 17953                                  
 17954                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 17955 0000183E 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 17956                                  					; read driver parm ?
 17957 00001843 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 17958 00001845 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 17959                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 17960 0000184A 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17961                                  ps2_30_problem:
 17962 0000184C 50                      		push	ax
 17963 0000184D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 17964                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17965                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18D7h
 17966                                  		;		 ; call BIOSDATA:call_orig13	
 17967                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 17968                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17969 0000184F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17970                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 17971                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17972 00001854 58                      		pop	ax
 17973 00001855 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17974                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17975                                  
 17976                                  ; 17/10/2022
 17977                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17978                                  
 17979                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 17980                                  
 17981                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 17982                                  
 17983                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 17984                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 17985                                  
 17986                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17987 00001857 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 17988                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 17989                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 17990 00001858 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 17991                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 17992                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 17993                                  
 17994                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 17995                                  
 17996 0000185D A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 17997 00001860 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 17998 00001863 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 17999                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 18000                                  format_special_stuff_done:
 18001 00001865 803E[A204]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 18002 0000186A 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 18003                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 18004                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 18005                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18006                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18EDh
 18007                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 18008 0000186C 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18009                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18010                                  		
 18011 00001871 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 18012                                  		
 18013 00001872 803E[AF05]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 18014                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 18015 00001877 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 18016                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 18017                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 18018 00001879 9D                      		popf
 18019 0000187A 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 18020                                  ret_from_i13:
 18021 0000187C 1F                      		pop	ds
 18022 0000187D CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 18023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18024                                  
 18025                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 18026                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 18027                                  ; a changeline error.
 18028                                  
 18029                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 18030 00001880 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 18031                                  i13_ret_error:				
 18032 00001882 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 18033 00001885 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 18034 00001887 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 18035 00001889 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 18036 0000188B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 18037 00001890 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 18038                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 18039                                  					; never	would
 18040 00001892 53                      		push	bx
 18041 00001893 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 18042 00001896 E8CB03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 18043 00001899 5B                      		pop	bx
 18044                                  int13b:
 18045 0000189A F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 18046 0000189B EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 18047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18048                                  
 18049                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 18050                                  
 18051                                  goterr13:
 18052 0000189D 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 18053 000018A0 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 18054                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 18055 000018A2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 18056 000018A5 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 18057 000018A7 803E[A905]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 18058 000018AC 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 18059                                  
 18060 000018AE 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 18061                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 18062                                  					; (2 = romread)
 18063                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 18064 000018B3 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 18065                                  
 18066 000018B5 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 18067                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 18068                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18069 000018B7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18070                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18071                                  					; call far 70:797h
 18072 000018BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 18073 000018BF 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 18074 000018C1 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 18075 000018C3 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 18076 000018C5 53                      		push	bx
 18077 000018C6 51                      		push	cx
 18078 000018C7 52                      		push	dx
 18079 000018C8 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 18080                                  loop_ecc:
 18081 000018CB B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18082                                  
 18083                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 18084                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 18085                                  ;
 18086                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 18087                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 18088                                  ; track.
 18089                                  ;
 18090                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 18091                                  ; this request.
 18092                                  ;
 18093                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 18094                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 18095                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 18096                                  ;
 18097 000018CE E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 18098                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 18099                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18100 000018D1 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18101                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18102 000018D6 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 18103 000018D8 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 18104 000018DB 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 18105 000018DD 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 18106 000018E0 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 18107                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18108                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 18109                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 18110 000018E2 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 18111                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 18112                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 18113                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 18114                                  ok11_op:
 18115 000018E4 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 18116 000018E8 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 18117 000018EA FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 18118                                  					; add 200h to address
 18119 000018EC FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18120 000018EE FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18121 000018F0 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 18122                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18123                                  
 18124                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 18125                                  
 18126                                  ok11_exit_err:
 18127 000018F2 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 18128                                  ok11_exit:
 18129 000018F3 5A                      		pop	dx
 18130 000018F4 59                      		pop	cx
 18131 000018F5 5B                      		pop	bx
 18132 000018F6 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18133                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18134                                  
 18135                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 18136                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 18137                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 18138                                  
 18139                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 18140 000018F8 06                      		push	es
 18141 000018F9 53                      		push	bx
 18142 000018FA BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18143 000018FD 1E                      		push	ds
 18144 000018FE 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 18145 000018FF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18146                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 18147                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18148 00001902 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18149                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18150 00001907 5B                      		pop	bx
 18151 00001908 07                      		pop	es
 18152 00001909 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 18153 0000190B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 18154 0000190E 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 18155                                  
 18156                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 18157                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 18158                                  
 18159                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 18160 00001910 56                      		push	si
 18161 00001911 57                      		push	di
 18162 00001912 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18163 00001914 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18164 00001917 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 18165 0000191A 5F                      		pop	di
 18166 0000191B 5E                      		pop	si
 18167 0000191C EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 18168                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18169                                  
 18170                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 18171                                  ; operation as best we can.
 18172                                  
 18173                                  gotdmaerr:
 18174 0000191E A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 18175 00001921 FB                      		sti
 18176 00001922 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 18177 00001925 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18178                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 18179                                  					; functions we don't handle
 18180 00001927 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 18181 0000192A 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 18182 0000192C 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18183 0000192F 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 18184 00001931 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18185                                  
 18186                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 18187                                  
 18188                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 18189                                  
 18190 00001933 52                      		push	dx
 18191 00001934 51                      		push	cx
 18192 00001935 53                      		push	bx
 18193 00001936 50                      		push	ax
 18194 00001937 55                      		push	bp
 18195 00001938 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 18196 0000193A 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 18197                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18198                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18199                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18200                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18201                                  		;add	dx, dx		; dx = dx*16
 18202 0000193C D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18203 0000193E D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18204 00001940 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18205 00001942 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 18206 00001944 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 18207 00001946 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 18208                                  
 18209                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 18210                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 18211                                  
 18212 0000194A 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 18213 0000194C E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 18214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18215                                  
 18216                                  no_skip_first:
 18217 0000194F D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 18218 00001951 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 18219 00001953 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 18220                                  
 18221                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 18222                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 18223                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 18224                                  ;
 18225                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 18226                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 18227                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 18228                                  ; in error.
 18229                                  
 18230 00001955 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 18231 00001957 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 18232                                  
 18233                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 18234                                  
 18235 00001959 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18236                                  					; set up head number
 18237 0000195C E888FE                  		call	doint
 18238 0000195F E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 18239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18240                                  
 18241                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 18242 00001962 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 18243 00001964 F9                      		stc
 18244 00001965 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 18245                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 18246                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18247                                  
 18248                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 18249                                  
 18250                                  intverify:
 18251 00001968 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 18252 00001969 53                      		push	bx
 18253 0000196A 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 18254 0000196B 07                      		pop	es
 18255                                  dosimple:
 18256 0000196C BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18257                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 18258                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 18259                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18260 0000196F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18261                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18262 00001974 5B                      		pop	bx
 18263 00001975 07                      		pop	es
 18264 00001976 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18265                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18266                                  
 18267                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 18268                                  
 18269                                  intformat:
 18270 00001979 06                      		push	es
 18271 0000197A 53                      		push	bx
 18272 0000197B 56                      		push	si
 18273 0000197C 57                      		push	di
 18274 0000197D 1E                      		push	ds
 18275                                  
 18276                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 18277                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 18278                                  
 18279 0000197E 06                      		push	es
 18280 0000197F 1E                      		push	ds
 18281 00001980 07                      		pop	es
 18282 00001981 1F                      		pop	ds
 18283 00001982 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 18284 00001984 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 18285 00001987 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 18286 0000198A 1F                      		pop	ds
 18287 0000198B 5F                      		pop	di
 18288 0000198C 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 18289 0000198D EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 18290                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18291                                  
 18292                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 18293                                  ; the first block.
 18294                                  ;
 18295                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 18296                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 18297                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 18298                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 18299                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 18300                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 18301                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 18302                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 18303                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 18304                                  
 18305                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18306                                  doblock:
 18307                                  
 18308                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 18309                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 18310                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 18311                                  				
 18312 0000198F 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18313                                  					; get head #, drive #
 18314 00001992 51                      		push	cx
 18315 00001993 06                      		push	es
 18316 00001994 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18317                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 18318 00001995 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 18319 00001998 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 18320                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18321 0000199C 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 18322                                  		; 12/12/2022
 18323                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 18324                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 18325 000019A1 5F                      		pop	di
 18326 000019A2 07                      		pop	es
 18327 000019A3 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 18328 000019A5 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 18329 000019A7 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 18330 000019A9 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18331                                  doblockflop:
 18332 000019AB 59                      		pop	cx
 18333                                  doblockcontinue:
 18334 000019AC 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 18335 000019AE 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 18336 000019B0 50                      		push	ax
 18337 000019B1 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 18338 000019B3 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 18339                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18340                                  
 18341                                  doblocklast:
 18342 000019B5 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 18343 000019B7 50                      		push	ax
 18344                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 18345 000019B8 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 18346 000019BB 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 18347 000019BD 58                      		pop	ax
 18348 000019BE 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 18349                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 18350 000019C1 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 18351 000019C3 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 18352 000019C5 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 18353 000019C7 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 18354 000019C9 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 18355                                  					; then we are done already.
 18356 000019CB 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 18357                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 18358 000019CD E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 18359 000019D0 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 18360                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18361                                  
 18362                                  bufferx:
 18363 000019D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18364                                  					; set up head number
 18365                                  buffer:
 18366 000019D5 53                      		push	bx
 18367 000019D6 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 18368 000019D9 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 18369 000019DC 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 18370                                  					
 18371                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 18372                                  
 18373 000019DE 06                      		push	es
 18374 000019DF 1E                      		push	ds
 18375 000019E0 56                      		push	si
 18376 000019E1 57                      		push	di
 18377 000019E2 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 18378 000019E3 06                      		push	es
 18379 000019E4 1F                      		pop	ds
 18380 000019E5 07                      		pop	es
 18381 000019E6 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 18382 000019E9 57                      		push	di		; save it
 18383 000019EA 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 18384 000019EC E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 18385 000019EF 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 18386                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 18387 000019F0 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 18388 000019F1 5E                      		pop	si
 18389 000019F2 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 18390                                  
 18391                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 18392                                  
 18393 000019F3 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18394                                  					; get drive number
 18395 000019F5 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 18396 000019F8 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 18397                                  					;
 18398                                  					; ah is	function
 18399                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 18400                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 18401                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 18402                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 18403                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 18404 000019FB E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 18405 000019FE 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 18406 000019FF 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 18407 00001A01 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 18408                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18409                                  
 18410                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 18411                                  
 18412                                  doread:
 18413 00001A03 06                      		push	es
 18414 00001A04 53                      		push	bx
 18415 00001A05 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 18416 00001A06 07                      		pop	es
 18417 00001A07 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18418 00001A0A B001                    		mov	al, 1
 18419 00001A0C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18420                                  					; get drive number
 18421 00001A0F E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 18422                                  					; ah = function
 18423                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 18424                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 18425                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 18426 00001A12 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 18427 00001A15 5B                      		pop	bx
 18428 00001A16 07                      		pop	es
 18429 00001A17 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 18430 00001A19 56                      		push	si
 18431 00001A1A 57                      		push	di
 18432 00001A1B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18433 00001A1D BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18434 00001A20 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 18435 00001A23 5F                      		pop	di
 18436 00001A24 5E                      		pop	si
 18437                                  
 18438                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 18439                                  
 18440                                  dotail:
 18441 00001A25 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 18442 00001A26 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 18443 00001A29 41                      		inc	cx
 18444 00001A2A 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 18445 00001A2D F8                      		clc
 18446 00001A2E FEC8                    		dec	al
 18447 00001A30 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 18448                                  
 18449                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 18450                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 18451                                  
 18452 00001A32 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18453 00001A35 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 18454 00001A38 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 18455                                  
 18456                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 18457                                  
 18458                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 18459                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 18460                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 18461                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 18462                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 18463                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 18464                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 18465                                  
 18466                                  bad13:
 18467 00001A3B 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 18468 00001A3D 5D                      		pop	bp
 18469 00001A3E 5B                      		pop	bx
 18470 00001A3F 5B                      		pop	bx
 18471 00001A40 59                      		pop	cx
 18472 00001A41 5A                      		pop	dx
 18473 00001A42 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 18474 00001A44 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 18475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18476                                  
 18477                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:	
 18478 00001A47 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 18479                                  
 18480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18481                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18482                                  		;db 	0
 18483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18484                                  
 18485                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 18495                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 18496 00001A4A 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 18497 00001A4E BF[3C05]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 18498 00001A51 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 18499 00001A52 07                      		pop	es
 18500 00001A53 E934EC                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 18501                                  
 18502                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18503                                  
 18504                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18505                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 18506                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 18507                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 18508                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18509                                  
 18510                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18511                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1AE0h
 18512                                  install_bds:
 18513 00001A56 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 18514 00001A57 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 18515                                  
 18516                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 18517                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 18518                                  loop_next_bds:
 18519 00001A5A C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 18520                                  					; fetch	next bds
 18521 00001A5C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 18522 00001A60 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 18523                                  					; drive	with new one?
 18524 00001A63 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 18525 00001A65 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 18526                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18527 00001A67 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18528                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18529                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 18530 00001A6B 085C3F                  		or	[si+3Fh], bl
 18531                                  		;or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18532 00001A6E 2680653FDF              		and	byte [es:di+3Fh], 0DFh
 18533                                  		;and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 18534                                  					; we don't own it
 18535 00001A73 8A5C3F                  		mov	bl, [si+3Fh]
 18536                                  		;mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18537                                  					; determine if changeline available
 18538 00001A76 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 18539 00001A79 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18540                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18541                                  next_bds:
 18542                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 18543 00001A7D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 18544 00001A80 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18545                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18546                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 18547 00001A82 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 18548 00001A84 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 18549                                  					; install bds
 18550 00001A87 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 18551 00001A89 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 18552                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 18553                                  					; set next pointer to null
 18554 00001A8C 1F                      		pop	ds
 18555                                  
 18556                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 18557                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 18558

 18560                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 18561                                  
 18562                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18563 00001A8D 268A4550                		mov	al, [es:di+50h]	; [es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 18564                                  		; 01/06/2019
 18565                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 18566                                  		; 22/07/2023
 18567                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]

 18571                                  _eot_ok:
 18572 00001A9A C3                      		retn

 18594 00001A9B F606[1208]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1
 18595                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?

 18597

 18600                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah

 18609                                  					; get the drive	letter
 18610

 18612                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 18614 00001AAD 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl

 18623

 18625
