 19997                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19998                                  
 19999                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20000                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 20001                                  
 20002                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 20003                                  
 20004                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 20005                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 20006                                  ;
 20007                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 20008                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 20009                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 20010                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 20011                                  ;
 20012                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 20013                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 20014                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 20015                                  
 20016                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 20017                                  
 20018                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20019                                  
 20020                                  ; 01/01/2024
 20021                                  %if 0
 20022                                  
 20023                                  struc	DPB
 20024                                  .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 20025                                  .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 20026                                  .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 20027                                  .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 20028                                  .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 20029                                  .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 20030                                  .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 20031                                  .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 20032                                  .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 20033                                  .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 20034                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 20035                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20036                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 20037                                  .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20038                                  .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 20039                                  .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 20040                                  .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 20041                                  .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 20042                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 20043                                  .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 20044                                  .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 20045                                  .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 20046                                  .size:
 20047                                  endstruc
 20048                                  
 20049                                  %else
 20050                                  
 20051                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20052                                  
 20053                                  struc	DPB
 20054 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1	; 0	; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 20055 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1	; 1	; Driver unit number of DPB
 20056 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1	; 2	; Size of physical sector in bytes
 20057 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1	; 4	; Sectors/cluster - 1
 20058 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1	; 5	; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 20059 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1	; 6	; Starting record of FATs
 20060 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1	; 8	; Number of FATs for this drive
 20061 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1	; 9	; Number of directory entries
 20062 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 11	; First sector of first cluster
 20063 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1	; 13	; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 20064 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1	; 15	; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20065 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 17	; Starting record of directory
 20066 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1  ; 19	; Pointer to driver
 20067 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1	; 23	; Media byte
 20068 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1	; 24	; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 20069                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 20070 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1	; 25	; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 20071 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1	; 29	; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 20072 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1	; 31	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 20073                                  ; FAT32 fs ; 01/01/2024
 20074                                  ; ref: https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/
 20075                                  ;      First_steps_towards_system_programming_under_MS-DOS_7/Appendix
 20076                                  ;   -- A.03-1. Structure of Drive Parameters Blocks (DPB) ---
 20077 00000021 ????                    .FREE_CNT_HW:	resw 1	; 33	; High word of free cluster count
 20078 00000023 ????                    .EXT_FLAGS:	resw 1	; 35	; FAT32 extended flags (active FAT number)
 20079 00000025 ????                    .FSINFO_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 37	; (FAT32 fs) FSINFO structure sector address
 20080 00000027 ????                    .BKBOOT_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 39	; (FAT32 fs) Backup Boot Sector address
 20081 00000029 ????????                .FCLUS_FSECTOR: resd 1	; 41	; The first cluster's first sector address
 20082 0000002D ????????                .LAST_CLUSTER:	resd 1	; 45	; The last cluster number
 20083 00000031 ????????                .FAT32_SIZE:	resd 1	; 49	; Number of FAT sectors (for FAT32 fs)	 
 20084 00000035 ????????                .ROOT_CLUSTER:	resd 1	; 53	; Root directory's cluster number (FAT32 fs)
 20085                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20086 00000039 ????????                .FAT32_NXTFREE:	resd 1  ; 57	; The next free cluster (for FAT32 fs)
 20087                                  .size:		; 61 bytes ; 01/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20088                                  endstruc

 20397                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20398                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 20399                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20400                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 20401                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 20402                                  									  
 20403                                  ;*******************************					  
 20404                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 20405                                  ;*******************************					  
 20406                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 20407                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 20408                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 20409                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 20410                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 20411                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 20412                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 20413                                  ;For all others:							  
 20414                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 20415                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 20416                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 20417                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 20418                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 20419                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 20420                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 20421                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 20422                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 20423                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 20424                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 20425                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 20426                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 20427                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 20428                                  ;									  
 20429                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 20430                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 20431                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 20432                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 20433                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 20434                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 20435                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 20436                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 20437                                  ;									  
 20438                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 20439                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 20440                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 20441                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 20442                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 20443                                  ;									  
 20444                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 20445                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 20446                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 20447                                  ;									  
 20448                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 20449                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 20450                                  ;									  
 20451                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 20452                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 20453                                  ;									  
 20454                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 20455                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 20456                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 20457                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 20458                                  ;						called. 		  
 20459                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 20460                                  ;									  
 20461                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20462                                  ;									  
 20463                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20464                                  ;									  
 20465                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20466                                  ;									  
 20467                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20468                                  ;									  
 20469                                  
 20470                                  ; 22/03/2019
 20471                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR

 20588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20589                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991)
 20590                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20591                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20592                                  
 20593                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 20594                                  ;
 20595                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 20596                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 20597                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 20598                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 20599                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 20600                                  ;
 20601                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 20602                                  ;
 20603                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 20604                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 20605                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 20606                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 20607                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 20608                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 20609                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 20610                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 20611                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 20612                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 20613                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 20614                                  
 20615                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 20616                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 20617                                  
 20618                                  struc 		curdir_list
 20619                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 20620 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 20621 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 20622 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 20623 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 20624 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 20625 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 20626                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 20627 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 20628 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 20629 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 20630                                  .size:
 20631                                  endstruc
 20632                                  
 20633                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 20634                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 20635                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 20636                                  						; argument
 20637                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 20638                                  
 20639                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 20640                                  
 20641                                  ;Flag word masks
 20642                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 20643                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 20644                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 20645                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 20646                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 20648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20649                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 20650                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20651                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20652                                  
 20653                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (BugFix)
 20654                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20655                                  
 20656                                  ; system file table
 20657                                  
 20658                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 20659                                  ;
 20660                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 20661                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 20662                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 20663                                  
 20664                                  struc	SF
 20665 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 20666 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 20667 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 20668                                  .size:
 20669                                  endstruc
 20670                                  
 20671                                  ;**	System file table entry
 20672                                  ;
 20673                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 20674                                  
 20675                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 20676 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 20677                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 20678 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 20679 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 20680 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 20681                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 20682                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 20683                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 20684                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 20685                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 20686                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 20687                                  					;   (WRITE)
 20688                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 20689                                  					;
 20690                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 20691                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 20692                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 20693                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 20694                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 20695                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 20696                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 20697                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 20698                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 20699                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 20700                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 20701                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 20702 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 20703                                  					; to device header if local device,
 20704                                  					; points to net device header if
 20705                                  					; remote
 20706 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 20707                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 20708 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 20709 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 20710 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 20711 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 20712                                  ;
 20713                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 20714                                  ; ID
 20715                                  ;
 20716 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 20717 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 20718 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 20719                                  ;
 20720                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 20721                                  ;
 20722 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 20723                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 20724                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 20725                                  					; disk changed errors.
 20726                                  ; SHARING INFO
 20727 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 20728 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 20729 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 20730 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 20731 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 20732 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 20733                                  .size:
 20734                                  endstruc
 20735

 21016                                  ; 05/07/2018
 21017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21018                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21019                                  
 21020                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21021                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 21022                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21023                                  
 21024                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 21025                                  ;
 21026                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 21027                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 21028                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 21029                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 21030                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 21031                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 21032                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 21033                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 21034                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 21035                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 21036                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 21037                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 21038                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 21039                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 21040                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 21041                                  ;
 21042                                  
 21043                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 21044                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 21045                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 21046                                  ;
 21047                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 21048                                  ;
 21049                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 21050                                  ;
 21051                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 21052                                  ;
 21053                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 21054                                  ;
 21055                                  
 21056                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 21057                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 21058                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 21059                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 21060                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 21061                                  ;      deeply nested one
 21062                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 21063                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interrupts on a PCjr.
 21064                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 21065                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 21066                                  
 21067                                  		;EVEN
 21068                                  ;align 2
 21069                                  		; 21/10/2022
 21070                                  
 21071 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 21072 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 21073 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 21074 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 21075 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 21076 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 21077                                  
 21078 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 21079 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 21080 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 21081                                  
 21082                                  ;***********************************************************************
 21083                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 21084                                  
 21085                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21086                                  
 21087 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 21088                                  
 21089                                  int02:
 21090                                  
 21091                                  ; *********************************************************************
 21092                                  ;
 21093                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 21094                                  ;
 21095                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 21096                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 21097                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 21098                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 21099                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 21100                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 21101                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 21102                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 21103                                  ;
 21104                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 21105                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 21106                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 21107                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 21108                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 21109                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 21110                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 21111                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 21112                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 21113                                  ;
 21114                                  ; *********************************************************************
 21115                                  
 21116 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 21117 00000017 06                      	push	es
 21118 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 21119 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21120                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21121 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 21122 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 21123 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 21124                                  
 21125 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 21126                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 21127                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 21128                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 21129                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 21130 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 21131 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 21132                                  special02:

 21134 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]

 21366                                  ;********************************************************************
 21367                                  ;common routines
 21368                                  ;********************************************************************
 21369                                  
 21370                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 21371                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 21372                                  ; service routine
 21373                                  
 21374                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21375                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21376                                  
 21377                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 21378                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 21379                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 21380                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 21381                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 21382                                  
 21383                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21384                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 21385                                  
 21386                                  do_int_stacks:
 21387 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 21388 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 21389 00000149 06                      	push	es
 21390 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 21391 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 21392 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 21393                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21394                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 21395                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21396 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 21397 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 21398 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 21399                                  
 21400 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 21401                                  
 21402                                  found02:
 21403 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 21404 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 21405                                  
 21406 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 21407                                  
 21408 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 21409                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21410                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 21411                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21412                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 21413 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 21414 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 21415                                  
 21416                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 21417 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 21418 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 21419 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 21420 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 21421 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 21422 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 21423 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21424 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 21425                                  
 21426                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 21427                                  	;push    bp
 21428                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 21429                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 21430                                  	;pop     bp
 21431                                  	;push    es
 21432                                  	;pop     ss
 21433                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 21434                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 21435                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21436                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 21437                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 21438                                  
 21439 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 21440                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21441 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 21442                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21443                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 21444                                  
 21445 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 21446                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21447 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 21448                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21449                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 21450 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 21451 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 21452                                  
 21453                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21454                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 21455                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21456 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 21457 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 21458                                  
 21459 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 21460 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 21461 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry

 23176                                  
 23177                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 23178                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 23179                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 23180                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 23181                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 23182                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 23183                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 23184                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 23185                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 23186                                  ;
 23187                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 23188                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 23189                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 23190                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 23191                                  ; been patched.
 23192                                  
 23193                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 23581 000008AA BA[2D4B]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 23582                                  
 23583                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 23584                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 23585                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 23586                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 23587                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 23588                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 23589                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 23590                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 23591                                  
 23592                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 23593                                  
 23594 000008AD 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 23595 000008AE BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 23598 000008B5 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC

 23600 000008B9 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 23601

 23603 000008BD B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 23604 000008BF CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 23605 000008C1 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 23606                                  
 23607                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 23608                                  
 23609                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 23610                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 23611                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 23612                                  
 23613                                  	; 22/10/2022
 23614                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 23616 000008C7 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 23617                                  
 23618                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 23619                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 23620                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 23621                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 23622                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 23623                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 23624                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 23625                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 23626                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 23627                                  ;
 23628                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 23629                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 23630                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 23631                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 23632                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 23633                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 23634                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 23635                                  
 23636                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

 24067                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 24068                                  ;
 24069                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.

 24074                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 24075                                  ; 
 24076                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 24078                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 24109                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24110                                  ;
 24111                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 24112                                  ;
 24113                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 24114                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 24115                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 24116                                  ;
 24117                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 24118                                  ;
 24119                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24120                                  
 24121                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24122                                  MovDOSHi:

 24124                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24125                                  	; ds = cs
 24126 00000AAE E8D600                  	call	AllocHMA

 24129 00000AB6 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24130                                  
 24131                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 24132                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 24133                                  
 24134                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 24135                                  	; 24/03/2019
 24136                                  	
 24137                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24138 00000AB8 E83200                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 24139                                  
 24140                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 24141                                  	
 24142                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24143                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24144                                  	;xor	di,di
 24145                                  	
 24146                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24147                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 24148                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24149                                  	; ds = cs
 24150 00000ABB 8B0E[8302]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 24151 00000ABF E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 24152                                  
 24153                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 24154                                  ;else
 24155                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 24156                                  ;
 24157                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0

 24159                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

 24198                                  	; NOTE: 
 24199                                  	;     Order of (RETRO) DOS kernel sections at memory:
 24200                                  	;	BIOSDATA+BIOSCODE+BIOSDATAINIT+DOSDATA+DOSCODE(LOW)

 24203                                  	;xor	di,di	
 24204

 24438                                  ;

 24440                                  ;
 24441                                  ;	Out : AX - seg of allocated memoryblock
 24442                                  ;
 24443                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24444                                  
 24445                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24446                                  	; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 24447                                  
 24448                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 24449                                  
 24450                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 24451                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24452                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24453                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24454                                  	; ds = cs
 24455                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 24456                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 24457                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24458 00000B0F B8701D                  	mov	ax,BCODE_END ; 1A60h	; 1A70h for MSDOS 6.21
 24459                                  					; 30/12/2022
 24460                                  	;mov	ax,1E00h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM ; 08/04/2024
 24461                                  	;sub	ax,BCODE_START ; 30h
 24462                                  	; 09/12/2022
 24463 00000B12 2D[3000]                	sub	ax,BCODESTART ; sub ax,30h ; 08/04/2024
 24464                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 24465                                  	; 02/11/2022

 24467                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24468                                  	; ds = cs
 24469 00000B15 0306[8102]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 24470 00000B19 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 24471 00000B1C E87B02                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 24472                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24473                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24474                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 24475 00000B1F 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 24476 00000B21 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 24477 00000B23 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 24478 00000B25 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 24479 00000B27 CD21                    	int	21h
 24480 00000B29 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 24481                                   	; 23/10/2022
 24482                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 24483 00000B2B 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 24484                                  						;  BIOS code
 24485 00000B2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24486                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 24487                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 24488                                  	; 14/05/2019
 24489                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 24490                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 24491                                  	; 08/04/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 24492                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24493 00000B30 26C70621000800          	mov	word [es:20h+1],08h		; mark it as system
 24494 00000B37 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC' ; 4353h	;  code area
 24495                                  
 24496 00000B3E C3                      	retn
 24497                                  
 24498                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 24499                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 24500                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 24501                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 24502                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 24503                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 24504                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 24505                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 24506                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 24507                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 24508                                  ;	  stub will go.
 24509                                  ;
 24510                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 24511                                  
 24512                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24513                                  update_arena:
 24514 00000B3F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 24515 00000B40 57                      	push	di
 24516 00000B41 51                      	push	cx
 24517 00000B42 52                      	push	dx
 24518                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24519                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 24520                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24521                                  	; ds = cs 
 24522 00000B43 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 24523 00000B47 4F                      	dec	di
 24524 00000B48 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 24525                                  						;  before sysvar
 24526 00000B49 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 24527                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 24528 00000B4B 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 24529 00000B50 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 24530 00000B52 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 24531                                  
 24532                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 24533 00000B54 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 24534 00000B59 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 24535 00000B5B 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 24536 00000B5D 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 24537 00000B5F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 24538                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 24539 00000B61 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 24540                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 24541 00000B65 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 24542 00000B6B 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 24543                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 24544 00000B6D 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 24545 00000B71 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 24546                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24547                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 24548 00000B73 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 24549 00000B76 5A                      	pop	dx
 24550 00000B77 59                      	pop	cx
 24551 00000B78 5F                      	pop	di
 24552 00000B79 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 24553 00000B7A C3                      	retn
 24554                                  ;
 24555                                  ; M012 : END
 24556                                  ;
 24557                                  FatalErr:
 24558 00000B7B 0E                      	push	cs
 24559 00000B7C 1F                      	pop	ds
 24560 00000B7D BA[480A]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 24561 00000B80 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 24562 00000B82 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 24563                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 24564                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 24565 00000B84 E9C707                  	jmp	stall
 24566                                  	; 23/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 24567                                  	;cli
 24568                                  	;hlt
 24569                                  
 24570                                  ;endif ;ROMDOS

 24574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24575                                  ;
 24576                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 24577                                  ;
 24578                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 24579                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 24580                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 24581                                  ;
 24582                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 24583                                  ;
 24584                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24585                                  
 24586                                  AllocHMA:
 24587                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 24588                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 24589                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 24590                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 24591                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 24592                                  
 24593                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 24594                                  ;
 24595                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 24596                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 24597                                  ;	push	ax
 24598                                  ;	popf
 24599                                  ;	pushf
 24600                                  ;	pop	ax
 24601                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 24602                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 24603                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 24604                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 24605                                  
 24606                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24607                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 24608                                  
 24609                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24610                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0C41h) 
 24611                                  
 24612 00000B87 1E                      	push	ds
 24613                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 24614                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 24615                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24616 00000B88 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 70h
 24617 00000B8B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 24618                                  
 24619 00000B8D E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 24620 00000B90 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 24621                                  
 24622 00000B92 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 24623 00000B95 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 24624                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 24625                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 24626                                  
 24627 00000B97 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 24628                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 24629 00000B9B 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 24630                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 24631                                  
 24632 00000B9F B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 24633 00000BA1 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 24634                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 24635 00000BA4 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 24636 00000BA8 48                      	dec	ax
 24637 00000BA9 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 24638                                  
 24639                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 24640                                  
 24641 00000BAB B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 24642 00000BAD CD15                    	int	15h
 24643                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 24644                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 24645                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 24646 00000BAF 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 24647                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 24648                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24649 00000BB2 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 24650                                  allocHMA_1:
 24651 00000BB4 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 24652                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 24653 00000BB6 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 24654 00000BBA 48                      	dec	ax
 24655 00000BBB 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 24656                                  
 24657 00000BBD E89D01                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 24658 00000BC0 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 24659                                  
 24660 00000BC2 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 24661 00000BC5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24662 00000BC7 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 24663 00000BCE 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 24664                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 24665                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24666 00000BD5 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 24667                                  
 24668                                  ; 11/12/2022
 24669                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 24670                                  ;	; cf=0
 24671                                  ;	;clc
 24672                                  ;	pop	ds
 24673                                  ;	retn
 24674                                  
 24675                                  grabhma_error:
 24676 00000BD7 F9                      	stc
 24677                                  	; 11/12/022
 24678                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 24679                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 24680 00000BD8 1F                      	pop	ds
 24681 00000BD9 C3                      	retn
 24682                                  
 24683                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24684                                  ;
 24685                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 24688                                  ;
 24689                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 24690                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 24691                                  ;
 24692                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24693                                  
 24694                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 24695 00000BDA B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 24696 00000BDD CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 24697                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 24698                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 24699 00000BDF 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 24700 00000BE1 C3                      	retn

 24702                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24703                                  ; procedure : FTryToMovDOSHi
 24704                                  ;
 24705                                  ;		Called from HMA suballoc calls
 24706                                  ;	
 24707                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24708                                  
 24709                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24710                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0A84h)
 24711                                  
 24712                                  	; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 24713                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0C9Fh)
 24714                                  
 24715                                  	; ((MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0B8Ch))
 24716                                  
 24717                                  FTryToMovDOSHi:	; proc	far
 24718                                  
 24719 00000BE2 50                      	push	ax
 24720 00000BE3 53                      	push	bx
 24721 00000BE4 51                      	push	cx

 24753                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24754                                  ;
 24755                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 24756                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 24757                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 24758                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 24759                                  ;
 24760                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 24761                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 24762                                  ;
 24763                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24764                                  
 24765                                  	; 30/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 24766 00000BFF 00                      	db	0
 24767                                  
 24768                                  ; 13/04/2024
 24769                                  ;align 2
 24770                                  
 24771                                  	; 30/12/2023
 24772                                  	; PCDOS v7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSYINIT:0CBCh
 24773                                  
 24774                                  StartVDHead:
 24775                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 24776                                  
 24777 00000C00 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 24778 00000C04 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 24779 00000C06 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 24780 00000C08 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 24781 00000C0A 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 24782                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 24783 00000C0B 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 24784                                  VDiskSig1:
 24785 00000C12 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 24786                                  
 24787                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 24788                                  
 24789 00000C17 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 24790                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 24791 00000C1D 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 24792 00000C2C 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 24793 00000C2E 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 24794                                  VDInt19:
 24795 00000C2F EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 24796                                  OldVDInt19:
 24797 00000C30 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 24798                                  
 24799                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 24800                                  
 24801                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 24802 00000C34 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 24803                                  VDiskSig2:
 24804 00000C37 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 24805                                  
 24806                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 24807                                  
 24808 00000C3C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 24809 00000C3F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 24810 00000C41 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 24811 00000C42 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 24812 00000C44 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 24813 00000C45 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 24814 00000C47 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 24815 00000C49 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 24816 00000C4A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 24817 00000C4C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 24818 00000C4E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 24819 00000C50 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 24820 00000C52 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 24821

 24824                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24825                                  ;
 24826                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 24827                                  ;
 24828                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 24829                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 24830                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 24831                                  ;
 24832                                  ; Inputs : None
 24833                                  ;
 24834                                  ; Outputs : None
 24835                                  ;
 24836                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 24837                                  ;
 24838                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24839                                  
 24840                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24841                                  
 24842                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 24843 00000C54 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24844 00000C56 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 24845                                  
 24846                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 24847                                  
 24848                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24849 00000C58 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 24850                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 24851 00000C5B 2EA3[300C]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 24852 00000C5F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 24853                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24854 00000C62 2EA3[320C]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24855                                  
 24856                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 24857                                  
 24858 00000C66 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 24859                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 24860                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24861 00000C68 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 24862 00000C6B CD21                    	int	21h
 24863                                  
 24864                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 24865                                  
 24866 00000C6D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 24867 00000C6E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24868                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 24869 00000C70 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 24870                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 24871 00000C77 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC' ; 4353h
 24872 00000C7E 40                      	inc	ax
 24873 00000C7F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 24874                                  
 24875                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 24876                                  
 24877 00000C81 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 24878                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 24879 00000C82 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 24880 00000C88 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 24881                                  
 24882                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 24883                                  
 24884                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 24885 00000C8B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 24886 00000C8E BE[000C]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 24887 00000C91 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 24888 00000C93 0E                      	push	cs
 24889 00000C94 1F                      	pop	ds
 24890 00000C95 FC                      	cld
 24891 00000C96 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24892 00000C98 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 24893                                  
 24894                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 24895                                  
 24896                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24897 00000C99 57                      	push	di
 24898 00000C9A 06                      	push	es
 24899                                  
 24900                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 24901                                  	;mov	es,ax
 24902                                  	; 03/09/2023
 24903 00000C9B 49                      	dec	cx
 24904                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 24905 00000C9C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24906                                  
 24907 00000C9E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 24908                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 24909 00000CA1 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 24910 00000CA4 BE[340C]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 24911 00000CA7 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 24912                                  
 24913 00000CA9 5F                      	pop	di
 24914 00000CAA 07                      	pop	es
 24915                                  
 24916 00000CAB C3                      	retn
