 24918                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24919                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 24920                                  ;
 24921                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 24922                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 24923                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 24924                                  ;
 24925                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24926                                  
 24927                                  struc desc
 24928 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 24929 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 24930 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 24931 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 24932 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 24933                                   .size:
 24934                                  endstruc
 24935                                  
 24936                                  		; 23/10/2022
 24937                                  bmove:		;label byte
 24938                                  
 24939                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 24940 00000CAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 24941                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 24942 00000CB4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 24943 00000CBC FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 24944 00000CBE 0000                    		dw	0
 24945 00000CC0 00                      		db	0
 24946 00000CC1 93                      		db	93h
 24947 00000CC2 0000                    		dw	0
 24948 00000CC4 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB

 24950 00000CC8 10                      		db	10h
 24951 00000CC9 93                      		db	93h

 24957 00000CD4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0

 24959 00000CDC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 24960                                  
 24961                                  
 24962                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 24963                                  
 24964                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 24965                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 24966                                  
 24967                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 24968                                  
 24969                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 24970                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24971                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 24972                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 24973                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 24974                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 24975                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 24976                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 24977                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 24978                                  ;								      ;I070
 24979                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 24980                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 24981                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 24982                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 24983                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 24984                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 24985                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 24986                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 24987                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 24988                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 24989                                  ;								      ;I070
 24990                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 24991                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24992                                  
 24993                                  	; 30/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24994                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0DBAh
 24995                                  ClrVDISKHeader:
 24996 00000CFC E464                    	in	al,64h	; 8042 keyboard controller status register
 24997                                  			; 7:  PERR    1=parity error in data received from keyboard
 24998                                  			;    +----------- AT Mode ----------+------------ PS/2 Mode ------------+
 24999                                  			; 6: |RxTO    receive (Rx) timeout  | TO     general timeout (Rx or Tx) |
 25000                                  			; 5: |TxTO    transmit (Tx) timeout | MOBF   mouse output buffer full   |
 25001                                  			;    +------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
 25002                                  			; 4:  INH     0=keyboard communications inhibited
 25003                                  			; 3:  A2      0=60h was the port last written to, 1=64h was last
 25004                                  			; 2:  SYS     distinguishes reset types: 0=cold reboot, 1=warm reboot
 25005                                  			; 1:  IBF     1=input buffer full (keyboard can't accept data)
 25006                                  			; 0:  OBF     1=output buffer full (data from keyboard is available)
 25007 00000CFE A810                    	test	al,10h	; test bit 4 - Is keyboard inhibited?
 25008 00000D00 7511                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move
 25009                                  	; 30/12/2023
 25010                                  	; ds = cs	
 25011 00000D02 813E[BB02]F819          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h ; check for TORTUGA models
 25012 00000D08 7408                    	jz	short ClrVDISKno ; do not use INT 15h block move code
 25013                                  				 ; (while 8042 is disabled)
 25014 00000D0A 813E[BB02]FC09          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],9FCh ; check for PS/2 30-286 model
 25015 00000D10 7501                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok
 25016                                  ClrVDISKno:
 25017 00000D12 C3                      	retn
 25018                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25019                                  	; 30/12/2023
 25020                                  ClrVDISKok:
 25021                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25022                                  	; ds = cs
 25023                                  
 25024                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 25025                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 25026                                  
 25027 00000D13 06                      	push	es
 25028 00000D14 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 25029 00000D16 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 25030 00000D18 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 25031 00000D1A D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 25032 00000D1C B104                    	mov	cl,4
 25033 00000D1E D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 25034 00000D20 05[DC0C]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 25035 00000D23 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 25036                                  
 25037                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 25038                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 25039                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 25040                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 25041                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 25042                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25043                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 25044 00000D26 A3[BE0C]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 25045                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 25046 00000D29 8816[C00C]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 25047                                  
 25048 00000D2D B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 25049 00000D30 0E                      	push	cs
 25050 00000D31 07                      	pop	es
 25051 00000D32 BE[AC0C]                	mov	si,bmove
 25052 00000D35 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 25053 00000D37 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 25054                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 25055                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 25056                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 25057 00000D39 07                      	pop	es
 25058 00000D3A C3                      	retn

 26194                                  
 26195                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 26196                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 26197                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 26198                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 26199                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 26200                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 26201                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 26202                                  ;
 26203                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 26204                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 26205                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 26206                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 26207                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 26208                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 26209                                  ;
 26210                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 26211                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 26212                                  ;
 26213                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 26214                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 26215                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 26216                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 26217                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 26218                                  ;
 26219                                  ;	for round-up machine
 26220                                  ;
 26221                                  ;			  none.
 26222                                  
 26223                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 26224                                  ;
 26225                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 26226                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 26227                                  
 26228                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26229                                  
 26230 000011B1 50                      	push	ax
 26231 000011B2 53                      	push	bx
 26232 000011B3 52                      	push	dx
 26233 000011B4 06                      	push	es
 26234                                  
 26235 000011B5 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 26236 000011B7 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 26237 000011BA EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 26238 000011BB 42                      	inc	dx
 26239 000011BC EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 26240 000011BD 42                      	inc	dx
 26241 000011BE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 26242 000011BF 42                      	inc	dx
 26243 000011C0 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 26244 000011C1 42                      	inc	dx
 26245 000011C2 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 26246 000011C3 42                      	inc	dx
 26247 000011C4 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f7h,0ffh
 26248                                  
 26249                                  ;sb secondary global rearm

 26267                                  startrearm:

 26269 000011E1 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address
 26270 000011E4 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f2h,0ffh
 26271 000011E5 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 26272 000011E6 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 26273 000011E7 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 26274 000011E8 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 26275 000011E9 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 26276 000011EA 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 26431                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26432                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26433                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 26434                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26435                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 26436                                  ;
 26437                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 26438                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 26439                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 26440                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 26441                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 26442                                  ; program).
 26443                                  
 26444                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 26445                                  
 26446                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 26447                                  
 26448 00001299 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 26449                                  
 26450                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 26451                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 26452                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 26453                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 26454                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 26455                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 26456                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 26457                                  ; carridge return.
 26458                                  
 26459                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 26460                                  ;character after =.
 26461                                  
 26462 0000129A 06                      	push	es
 26463 0000129B 1E                      	push	ds
 26464 0000129C 07                      	pop	es
 26465 0000129D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 26466 0000129E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 26467                                  
 26468 000012A0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26469 000012A2 FC                      	cld
 26470 000012A3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 26471 000012A9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 26472                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 26473 000012AC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 26474                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26475 000012AD 08C0                    	or	al,al
 26476                                  	;cmp	al,0
 26477                                  	;je	short got_installparm
 26478                                  	;jmp	short installfilename
 26479                                  	; 10/04/2024
 26480 000012AF 75FB                    	jnz	short installfilename
 26481                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 26482 000012B1 AC                      	lodsb
 26483 000012B2 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 26484 000012B5 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 26485 000012B7 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 26486 000012B9 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 26487 000012BB 47                      	inc	di
 26488 000012BC EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 26489                                  done_installparm:
 26490 000012BE 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 26491                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26492 000012C3 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 26493                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 26494 000012C5 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 26495 000012C7 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 26496                                  					; starts with cr.
 26497                                  install_seg_set:
 26498                                  	; 05/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 26499 000012CD 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx

 26505                                  ;
 26506                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 26507                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 26508                                  ;
 26509                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.

 26605                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26606                                  
 26607                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 26608                                  ;
 26609                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 26610                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 26611                                  ;
 26612                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 26613                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 26614                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 26615                                  
 26616                                  ParaRound:
 26617 00001315 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 26618 00001318 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 26619 0000131A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26620 0000131C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26621 0000131E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26622 00001320 C3                      	retn
 26623                                  
 26624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26625                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 26626                                  ;
 26627                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 26628                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 26629                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 26630                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 26631                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 26632                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 26633                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 26634                                  ;
 26635                                  ;in: after relocation,
 26636                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 26637                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 26638                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 26639                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 26640                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 26641                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 26642                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 26643                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 26644                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 26645                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 26646                                  ;
 26647                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 26648                                  
 26649                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26650                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26651                                  sysinit_base:				
 26652 00001321 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 26653 00001326 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 26654 0000132B CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 26655 0000132D 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 26656 00001332 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 26657 00001337 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 26658 00001338 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 26659 00001339 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 26660                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 26661                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 26662 0000133B E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 26663 0000133E 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 26664 00001343 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 26665                                  
 26666                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 26667                                  
 26668 00001345 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 26669 00001347 0E                      	push	cs
 26670 00001348 1F                      	pop	ds
 26671                                  	; 30/12/2022
 26672                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 26673                                  	;mov	dx,102
 26674 00001349 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26675                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 26676 0000134C CD21                    	int	21h
 26677                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 26678                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 26679                                  
 26680                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 26681                                  stall:
 26682                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26683                                  _stall: 
 26684                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26685 0000134E F4                      	hlt 
 26686                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26687                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 26688 0000134F EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 26689                                  
 26690                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 26691 00001351 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 26692                                  
 26693                                  ;-------------------------------------
 26694                                  
 26695                                  sum_up:
 26696                                  
 26697                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 26698                                  ;out:  ax - result
 26699                                  ;
 26700                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 26701                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 26702                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 26703                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 26704                                  ;
 26705                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 26706                                  
 26707 00001356 1E                      	push	ds
 26708                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26709                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 26710 00001357 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 26711                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26712                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 26713 0000135B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 26714 0000135D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 26715 0000135F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 26716 00001361 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 26717                                  					; whole test better fail.
 26718 00001366 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 26719 00001368 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 26720                                  sum1:
 26721 0000136A 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 26722 0000136C 46                      	inc	si
 26723 0000136D 46                      	inc	si
 26724 0000136E E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 26725                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 26726                                  sum_sys_code:
 26727                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26728 00001370 BE7013                  	mov	si,locstack ;; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26729                                  			    ;; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26730                                  			    ; 10/04/2024	
 26731                                  			    ; 586h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)	
 26732                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 26733                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 26734                                  	;;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 26735                                  	; 02/11/2022
 26736                                  	;;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 26737                                  	; 10/04/2024
 26738                                  	;mov	cx,5B40h  ; (23360) for PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT)	
 26739                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 26740 00001373 B9[1054]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 26741 00001376 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 26742 00001378 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 26743                                  sum2:
 26744 0000137A 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 26745 0000137D 46                      	inc	si
 26746 0000137E 46                      	inc	si
 26747 0000137F E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 26748 00001381 1F                      	pop	ds
 26749 00001382 C3                      	retn
 26750                                  
 26751                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26752                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26753                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 26754                                  ; 10/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)
 26755                                  ; (SYSINIT:149Dh)
 26756                                  
 26757                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 26758                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 26781                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26782                                  ; Set_Buffer
 26783                                  ;
 26784                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 26785                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 26786                                  ;
 26787                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 26788                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 26789                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 26790                                  ;
 26791                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 26792                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 26793                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26794                                  
 26795                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26796                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 26797                                  
 26798                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 26799                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:14BCh)
 26800                                  
 26801                                  set_buffer:
 26802 000013A2 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 26803 000013A4 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 26804 000013A7 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 26805 000013A9 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 26806                                  set_buff_1:
 26807                                  	; 25/10/2022
 26808                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 26809 000013AB 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 26810                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 26811 000013AD 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 26812                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 26813 000013B0 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 26814                                  
 26815 000013B5 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 26816 000013B7 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 26817 000013BC 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 26818                                  
 26819                                  ;	for each buffer
 26820                                  
 26821                                  nxt_buff:

 26823 000013C0 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 26824 000013C2 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 26825                                  
 26826 000013C4 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 26827

 26829                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first

 26833                                  	; 25/10/2022

 26835

 26837 000013D5 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 26841                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 26844 000013E4 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 26849                                  	;sub	ax,20
 26850 000013EB 83E818                  	sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 26851                                  
 26852                                  set_buff_2:
 26853 000013EE 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 26854                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2

 26859 000013F9 E9F633                  	jmp	round

 26861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26862                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 26863                                  ;
 26864                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 26865                                  ;
 26866                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 26867                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 26868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26869                                  
 26870                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 26871                                  GetBufferAddr:
 26872 000013FC 53                      	push	bx
 26873 000013FD 52                      	push	dx
 26874                                  
 26875                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26876                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26877                                  	;;;
 26878 000013FE 2E803E[6E03]02          	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 26879                                  				; is dosdata moved to UMB ? (DOSDATA=UMB done)
 26880 00001404 7506                    	jne	short gba_1     ; no
 26881 00001406 837F02FF                	cmp	word [bx+2],0FFFFh ; is the buffer (already) in HMA ?
 26882 0000140A 7423                    	je	short gba_2	; yes
 26883                                  gba_1:
 26884                                  	;;;
 26885                                  
 26886 0000140C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 26887 00001410 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 26888                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 26889 00001415 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 26890                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26891                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 26892                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26893 00001418 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 26894 0000141A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 26895 0000141C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 26896                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 26897 0000141F CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 26898                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 26899                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 26900                                  			; Return:
 26901                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 26902                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 26903                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 26904                                  			; Notes:
 26905                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 26906                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 26907                                  
 26908 00001421 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 26909 00001424 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 26910                                  	
 26911                                  	;mov	di,0		; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 26912                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26913                                  	; zf=1
 26914 00001426 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 26915                                  	; zf=1
 26916                                  	
 26917                                  	;zf=1
 26918                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 26919                                  	;zf=1
 26920 00001427 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 26921                                  got_hma:
 26922 0000142C 5A                      	pop	dx
 26923 0000142D 5B                      	pop	bx
 26924 0000142E C3                      	retn
 26925                                  
 26926                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26927                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26928                                  	;;;
 26929                                  gba_2:
 26930 0000142F C43F                    	les	di,[bx]
 26931 00001431 09FF                    	or	di,di
 26932                                  	;pop	dx
 26933                                  	;pop	bx
 26934                                  	;retn
 26935                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26936 00001433 EBF7                    	jmp	short got_hma
 26937                                  	;;;

 26941                                  set_buffer_info:

 26943                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 26944                                  ;
 26945                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 26946                                  ;    ax = di
 26947                                  ;

 26957                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 26958 00001447 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 26959                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 26960 0000144A 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 26961                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 26962 00001450 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 26963                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 26964 00001456 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 26965 0000145C C3                      	retn
 26966                                  
 26967                                  ; ======================================================================
 26968                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 26969                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26970                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26971                                  
 26972                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26973                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 26974                                  ;
 26975                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 26976                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 26977                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 26978                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 26979                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 26980                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 26981                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 26982                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 26983                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 26984                                  ;
 26985                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 26986                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 26987                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 26988                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 26989                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 26990                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 26991                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 26992                                  ;	conditions:
 26993                                  ;
 26994                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 26995                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 26996                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 26997                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 26998                                  ;
 26999                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 27000                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 27001                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 27002                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 27003                                  ;
 27004                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 27005                                  ;
 27006                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 27007                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 27008                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 27009                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 27010                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 27011                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 27012                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 27013                                  ;	interrupt line.
 27014                                  ;
 27015                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 27016                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 27017                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 27018                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 27019                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 27020                                  ;
 27021                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 27022                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 27023                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 27024                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 27025                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 27026                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 27027                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 27028                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 27029                                  ;
 27030                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 27031                                  
 27032                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27033                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 27034                                  
 27035                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 27036                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:157Ch)
 27037                                  
 27038                                  	; 14/12/2022
 27039                                  stackinit:
 27040 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 27041 0000145E 1E                      	push	ds
 27042 0000145F 06                      	push	es
 27043 00001460 53                      	push	bx
 27044 00001461 51                      	push	cx
 27045 00001462 52                      	push	dx
 27046 00001463 57                      	push	di
 27047 00001464 56                      	push	si
 27048 00001465 55                      	push	bp
 27049                                  
 27050                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 27051                                  
 27052                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27053                                  	; ds = cs
 27054 00001466 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 27055 00001469 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 27056                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27057                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 27058                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 27059 0000146B 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 27060                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 27061 0000146F A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 27062 00001472 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 27063                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27064 00001476 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 27065                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27066                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 27067                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 27068 00001479 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 27069                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27070 0000147D 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 27071 0000147F A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 27072                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27073                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 27074                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 27075 00001482 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 27076                                  
 27077                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 27078                                  
 27079                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 27080                                  
 27081                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 27082                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27083                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 27084 00001486 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 27085                                  
 27086                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 27087                                  
 27088 0000148B B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 27089                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 27090                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27091                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 27092 0000148E F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27093 00001490 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 27094 00001492 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 27095 00001496 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27096 00001498 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 27097                                  
 27098                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 27099                                  
 27100 0000149B 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 27101 000014A0 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 27102 000014A4 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27103 000014A6 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27104 000014A8 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27105 000014AA 06                      	push	es
 27106 000014AB 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 27107                                  
 27108                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 27109                                  
 27110 000014AC 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 27111 000014B0 FC                      	cld
 27112 000014B1 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 27113                                  
 27114 000014B3 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 27115                                  
 27116                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 27117                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 27118                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 27119                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 27120                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 27121                                  
 27122                                  buildloop:
 27123                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27124                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 27125                                  	; 25/10/2022
 27126                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 27127                                  	; 06/07/2023
 27128 000014B7 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 27129 000014BB 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 27130                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 27131 000014BF 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 27132                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 27133 000014C3 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 27134                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 27135 000014C7 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 27137                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 27138 000014CF 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 27139 000014D2 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 27140                                  
 27141 000014D5 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 27142                                  
 27143 000014D7 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 27144 000014DA 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 27145 000014DE 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 27146                                  
 27147 000014E2 1E                      	push	ds
 27148                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 27149                                  	; 05/09/2023

 27152 000014E7 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?

 27154 000014ED 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 27155

 27158

 27886                                  new_init_loop:
 27887                                  	;;; 13/04/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 27888 0000164F 2E803E[6E03]02          	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 27889                                  				; is DOSDATA=UMB done ? (DOSDATA is in UMB)
 27890 00001655 7510                    	jne	short new_init_loop_1st
 27891 00001657 1E                      	push	ds		; restore original/previous interrupt handler
 27892                                  				; (from int19old?? field in BIOSDATA)
 27893                                  	;mov	ax,70h
 27894 00001658 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 27895 0000165B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 27896 0000165D C505                    	lds	ax,[di]		; restore original Int ?? handler addr from int19old?? field
 27897 0000165F 268904                  	mov	[es:si],ax	; copy the original int handler addr to its int vector addr
 27898 00001662 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 27899 00001666 1F                      	pop	ds
 27900                                  new_init_loop_1st: 
 27901                                  	;;;
 27902                                  
 27903                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 27904                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 27905                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 27906                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 27907                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 27908                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 27909                                  
 27910                                  ; 13/04/2024
 27911                                  %if 0
 27912                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27913                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27914                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27915                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27916                                  
 27917                                  	push	ds
 27918                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 27919                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 27920                                  	; 21/10/2022
 27921                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27922                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27923                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 27924                                  	mov	[di],ax
 27925                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 27926                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27927                                  	pop	ds
 27928                                  %else
 27929                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27930 00001667 1E                      	push	ds
 27931 00001668 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27932 0000166C 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27933 0000166F 50                      	push	ax
 27934 00001670 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27935 00001673 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27936 00001675 50                      	push	ax
 27937 00001676 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27938 00001679 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27939 0000167B 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 27940 0000167C 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 27941 0000167E 58                      	pop	ax
 27942 0000167F 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27943 00001682 1F                      	pop	ds
 27944                                  %endif
 27945 00001683 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 27946 00001686 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds

 28232                                  			  		; the array address is in [bpb_addr] (*)

 28244                                  			  		; FAT32 DPB (61 bytes)

 28255                                  			  	; DS:SI -> BPB (BIOS Parameter Block)

 28270 0000185D C3                      	retn
 28271

 28279 0000186F FEC6                    	inc	dh			; increment unit number

 28282                                  					; (in the BPB array) (*) -add bx,2-

 28284 00001874 7403                    	jz	short _linkit
 28285 00001876 E973FF                  	jmp	_foundpb

 28287                                  _linkit:

 28303                                  	; ds = cs

 28320                                  
 28321                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 28324                                  ;***	MagicPostload -- called to clean up and make sure Magic is final placed
 28325                                  
 28326                                  MagicPostload:
 28327                                  	; 13/04/3024
 28328                                  	; ds = cs
 28329 000018B7 E89C00                  	call	get_dblspace_version	; is it there?

 28334 000018C5 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28335                                  					; DBLSPACE.BIN - GET RELOCATION SIZE
 28336 000018C8 CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; get paragraphs into ax
 28337 000018CA 40                      	inc	ax			; extra 2 paragraphs for the stub
 28338 000018CB 40                      	inc	ax			; ((tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)+15)/16
 28339                                  					; (18+15)/16 = 2
 28340                                  	;mov	[cs:DevSize],ax		; store that (**)

 28343                                  	;				; arena header can be set

 28351                                  
 28352 000018DE E8112F                  	call	round			; normalize memhi:memlo
 28353 000018E1 E8811C                  	call	InitDevLoad		; set up sub-arena,DevLoadAddr,
 28354                                  			  		; DevLoadEnd,and DevEntry
 28355                                  					; gets arena name from bpb_addr
 28356                                  	; 13/04/2024
 28357                                  	; ds = cs
 28358                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevLoadAddr]	; (**) (InitDevload sets this)
 28359 000018E4 8E06[3524]              	mov	es,[DevLoadAddr]
 28360                                  
 28361                                  ;	First, move a little header in place so that this looks
 28362                                  ;	to the mem command like a legitimate driver load. Otherwise,
 28363                                  ;	it will display garbage for the device name
 28364                                  
 28365 000018E8 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; move a little header in place
 28366                                  					; so that this looks to the mem command
 28367                                  					; like a legitimate driver load
 28368 000018EA BE[C816]                	mov	si,tiny_stub_start
 28369                                  	;mov	cx,18			; (tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)
 28370 000018ED B91200                  	mov	cx,tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start
 28371 000018F0 F3A4                    	rep movsb			; move it!
 28372 000018F2 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; advance es appropriately
 28373 000018F4 40                      	inc	ax			; add ax,((tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)+15)/16
 28374 000018F5 40                      	inc	ax
 28375 000018F6 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 28376 000018F8 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh ; -2		; final placement!
 28377 000018FB B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28378 000018FE CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; DBLSPACE.BIN - RELOCATE
 28379                                  					; es = segment to which to relocate DBLSPACE.BIN
 28380                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadAddr] ; (**)
 28381                                  	;add	ax,[cs:DevSize]		; calculate seg after DD load
 28382                                  	;mov	[cs:DevBrkAddr+2],ax	; save as ending address!
 28383                                  	;mov	word [cs:DevBrkAddr],0
 28384                                  	; 13/04/2024
 28385                                  	; ds = cs
 28386 00001900 A1[3524]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadAddr]
 28387 00001903 0306[3324]              	add	ax,[DevSize]
 28388 00001907 A3[3F24]                	mov	[DevBrkAddr+2],ax
 28389 0000190A C706[3D24]0000          	mov	word [DevBrkAddr],0
 28390                                  
 28391 00001910 E8F31D                  	call	DevSetBreak		; go ahead and alloc mem for device
 28392                                  	;call	DevBreak
 28393                                  ;no_magic:
 28394                                  	;retn
 28395                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28396 00001913 E9121E                  	jmp	DevBreak
 28397                                  
 28398                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E ==================================
 28399                                  
 28400                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28401                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:1C08h)
 28402                                  
 28403                                  ;***	MagicSetCdss -- disable CDSs for still unmounted DblSpace drives
 28404                                  ;
 28405                                  ;	entry:
 28406                                  ;	   CDSs are now persistent and in their final place
 28407                                  
 28408                                  MagicSetCdss:
 28409                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28410                                  	; ds = cs
 28411 00001916 E83D00                  	call	get_dblspace_version	; is it there?
 28412 00001919 753A                    	jnz	short magic_set_exit	; done if not
 28413                                  					; cl = first DblSpace drive in ASCII
 28414                                  					; ch = number of DblSpace drive letters
 28415 0000191B 2EC536[6D02]            	lds	si,[cs:DOSINFO]		; point to DOS data area (SysInitVars)
 28416 00001920 C57416                  	lds	si,[si+16h]		; lds si,[si+SYSI_CDS] ; fetch CDSs
 28417 00001923 B458                    	mov	ah,88			; curdirLen
 28418 00001925 80E941                  	sub	cl,'A'			; make it zero based.
 28419 00001928 88C8                    	mov	al,cl			; get first DblSpace drive letter
 28420 0000192A F6E4                    	mul	ah			; find first DblSpace CDS
 28421 0000192C 01C6                    	add	si,ax			; cds pointer
 28422 0000192E 88CA                    	mov	dl,cl			; save for drive testing loop
 28423 00001930 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch			; get DblSpace drive count into cx
 28424 00001932 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 28425                                  
 28426                                  ;	We know cx > 0, or else the driver wouldn't have stayed resident
 28427                                  
 28428                                  magic_set_cdss_1:
 28429 00001934 51                      	push	cx
 28430 00001935 52                      	push	dx
 28431 00001936 1E                      	push	ds
 28432 00001937 56                      	push	si
 28433 00001938 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28434 0000193B BB0100                  	mov	bx,1			; MD_DRIVE_MAP ; inquire drive map
 28435 0000193E CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; DBLSPACE.BIN - "GetDriveMapping"
 28436                                  					; see if this is an unused DblSpace drive
 28437 00001940 5E                      	pop	si
 28438 00001941 1F                      	pop	ds
 28439 00001942 5A                      	pop	dx
 28440 00001943 59                      	pop	cx
 28441 00001944 38DA                    	cmp	dl,bl			; if mapped to itself,it is vacant
 28442 00001946 7504                    	jnz	short magic_set_cdss_2	; skip if used
 28443 00001948 806444BF                	and	byte [si+44h],0BFh 	; Retro DOS v5.0 ; 08/04/2024
 28444                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh
 28445                                  					; reset the bit in flags (curdir_inuse bit)
 28446                                  					; [si+curdir_list.cdir_flags],~curdir_inuse ; word
 28447                                  					; (.. [si+1+curdir_list.cdir_flags],0BFh ; byte)
 28448                                  magic_set_cdss_2:
 28449 0000194C 83C658                  	add	si,88			; curdirLen
 28450 0000194F FEC2                    	inc	dl			; next drive
 28451 00001951 E2E1                    	loop	magic_set_cdss_1
 28452                                  	; 13/04/2024
 28453 00001953 0E                      	push	cs
 28454 00001954 1F                      	pop	ds
 28455                                  magic_set_exit:
 28456 00001955 C3                      	retn
 28457                                  
 28458                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E ==================================
 28459                                  
 28460                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28461                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:1C47h)
 28462                                  
 28463                                  get_dblspace_version:
 28464 00001956 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h 	; multMagicdrv
 28465                                  				; DBLSPACE.BIN - "GetVersion" - INSTALLATION CHECK
 28466                                  			 	; (BX = 0)
 28467 00001959 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx	 	; MD_VERSION = 0
 28468 0000195B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	 	; Return:
 28469                                  			 	;  AX = 0000h (successful)
 28470                                  			 	;  BX = 444Dh ("DM")
 28471                                  			 	;  CL = first drive letter used by DBLSPACE (41h = A:)
 28472                                  			 	;  CH = number of drive letters used by DBLSPACE
 28473                                  			 	;  DX = internal DBLSPACE.BIN version number (bits 14-0)
 28474                                  			 	;  bit 15 set if DBLSPACE.BIN has not yet been relocated
 28475                                  			 	;  to final position in memory (i.e. DBLSPACE.SYS /MOVE)
 28476 0000195D 09C0                    	or	ax,ax	 	; ax = 0 (successful,zf=1)
 28477 0000195F C3                      	retn
 28478
