 28679                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28680                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 28681                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 28682                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 28683                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28684                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 28685                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 28686                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 28687                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28688                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 28689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28690                                  
 28691                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 28692                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 28693 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 28694 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 28695 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 28696                                  endstruc
 28697                                  
 28698                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 28699                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 28700                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 28701                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 28702                                  
 28703                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28704                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 28705                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 28706                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 28707                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 28708                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 28709                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 28710                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 28711                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 28712                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 28713                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 28714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28715                                  
 28716                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 28717                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 28718 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 28719 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 28720 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 28721                                  endstruc
 28722                                  
 28723                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28724                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 28725                                  ;
 28726                                  ;
 28727                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 28728                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 28729                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28730                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28731                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28732                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28733                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28734                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28735                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28736                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28737                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28738                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 28739                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 28740                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 28741                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 28742                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 28743                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 28744                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 28745                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 28746                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 28747                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 28748                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 28749                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 28750                                  ;	   :
 28751                                  ;
 28752                                  ;Note:
 28753                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 28754                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 28755                                  ;
 28756                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 28757                                  ;
 28758                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 28759                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 28760                                  ;
 28761                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 28762                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 28763                                  ;
 28764                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 28765                                  ;
 28766                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 28767                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 28768                                  ;
 28769                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28770                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 28771                                  ;
 28772                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 28773                                  ;
 28774                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28775                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 28776                                  ;
 28777                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28778                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28779                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28780                                  ;
 28781                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 28782                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 28783                                  ;
 28784                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 28785                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 28786                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 28787                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28788                                  
 28789                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 28790                                  
 28791                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 28792                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 28793                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 28794                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 28795                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 28796                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 28797                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 28798                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 28799                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 28800                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 28801                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 28802                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 28803                                  
 28804                                  ;**** Function flags
 28805                                  
 28806                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 28807                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 28808                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 28809                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 28810                                  
 28811                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 28812                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 28813 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 28814 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 28815 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 28816 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 28817 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 28818 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 28819                                  endstruc
 28820                                  
 28821                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28822                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 28823                                  ;
 28824                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 28825                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 28826                                  ;	     +-
 28827                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 28828                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 28829                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 28830                                  ;	     |	:
 28831                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28832                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 28833                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 28834                                  ;	     |	:
 28835                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28836                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 28837                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 28838                                  ;	     +-	:
 28839                                  ;
 28840                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 28841                                  ;
 28842                                  ;Note:
 28843                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 28844                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 28845                                  ;
 28846                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28847                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28848                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28849                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28850                                  
 28851                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 28852                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 28853                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 28854                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 28855                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 28856                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 28857                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 28858                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 28859                                  
 28860                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 28861 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 28862 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 28863 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 28864 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 28865 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 28866                                  endstruc
 28867                                  
 28868                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28869                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 28870                                  ;
 28871                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 28872                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 28873                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 28874                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 28875                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 28876                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 28877                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 28878                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 28879                                  ;
 28880                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 28881                                  ;
 28882                                  ;            +-
 28883                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 28884                                  ;	    | or
 28885                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 28886                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 28887                                  ;	    | or
 28888                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 28889                                  ;	    | or
 28890                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 28891                                  ;	    | or
 28892                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 28893                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 28894                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 28895                                  ;	    | or
 28896                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 28897                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 28898                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 28899                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 28900                                  ;	    +-
 28901                                  ;
 28902                                  ;
 28903                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 28904                                  ;      list.
 28905                                  ;
 28906                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 28907                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 28908                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 28909                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28910                                  
 28911                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 28912                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 28913 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 28914 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 28915 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 28916 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 28917                                  endstruc
 28918                                  
 28919                                  ;--------------------------------
 28920                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 28921                                  
 28922                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 28923                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 28924                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 28925                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 28926                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 28927                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 28928                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 28929                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 28930                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 28931                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 28932                                  
 28933                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 28934                                  
 28935                                  ;**** Return code
 28936                                  ;
 28937                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 28938                                  
 28939                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 28940                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 28941                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 28942                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 28943                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 28944                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 28945                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 28946                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 28947                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 28948                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 29037                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29038                                  ; SysParse;
 29039                                  ;
 29040                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 29041                                  ;
 29042                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 29043                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 29044                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 29045                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 29046                                  ;
 29047                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 29048                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 29049                                  ;		 is in DS.
 29050                                  ;
 29051                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 29052                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 29053                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 29054                                  ;
 29055                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 29056                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 29057                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 29058                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 29059                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 29060                                  ;
 29061                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 29062                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 29063                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 29064                                  ;
 29065                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 29066                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 29067                                  ;
 29068                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 29069                                  ;
 29070                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 29071                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 29072                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 29073                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 29074                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 29075                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 29076                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 29077                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 29078                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 29079                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 29080                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 29081                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 29082                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 29083                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 29084                                  ;	     (tm08)
 29085                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 29086                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 29087                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 29088                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 29089                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 29090                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 29091                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 29092                                  ;					  (tm12)
 29093                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 29094                                  ;					  (tm13)
 29095                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 29096                                  ;					  (tm14)
 29097                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 29098                                  ;					  (tm15)
 29099                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 29100                                  
 29101                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 29102                                  
 29103                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 29104                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 29105                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 29106                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 29107                                  
 29108                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 29109                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 29110                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 29111                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 29112                                  ;
 29113                                  
 29114                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 29115                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 29116                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 29117                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 29118                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 29119                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 29120                                  
 29121                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 29122                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 29123                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 29124                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 29125                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 29126                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 29127                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 29128                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 29129                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 29130                                  
 29131                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 29132                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 29133                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 29134                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 29135                                  ;	     segment.
 29136

 29138                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 29139                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 29141                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 29142                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 29235                                  SysParse:
 29236                                  	; 06/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 29237                                  	; dx = 0
 29238 00001A15 1E                      	push	ds ; *!*
 29239 00001A16 0E                      	push	cs
 29240 00001A17 1F                      	pop	ds 
 29241                                  
 29242                                  	;mov	word [cs:_$P_Flags],0	;AC034; Clear all internal flags
 29243                                  	;cld				;AN000; confirm forward direction
 29244                                  	;mov	word [cs:_$P_ORDINAL],cx ;AC034; save operand ordinal
 29245                                  	;mov	word [cs:_$P_RC],_$P_No_Error ;AC034; Assume no error

 29737                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29738                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 29739                                  ;
 29740                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 29741                                  ;
 29742                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 29743                                  ;	    AL = type
 29744                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 29745                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 29746                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 29747                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 29748                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 29749                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 29750                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 29751                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 29752                                  ;
 29753                                  ; Output:   None
 29754                                  ;
 29755                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 29756                                  ;
 29757                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 29758                                  ;***********************************************************************

 31121                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 31122                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 31123                                  ;
 31124                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 31125                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 31126                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 31127                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31128                                  
 31129                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 31130                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 31131                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 31132                                  
 31133                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 31134 00002118 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 31135 00002119 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 31136 0000211A 2EC606[7719]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 31137                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 31138                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 31139 00002120 2E8026[7D19]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 31140 00002126 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 31141 00002128 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 31142                                  
 31143 0000212A 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 31144 0000212C 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 31145                                  
 31146 0000212E 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 31147 00002130 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 31148                                  
 31149                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 31150                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 31151                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 31152                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 31153                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 31154                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 31155                                  %if 0
 31156                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31157                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 31158                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 31159                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 31160                                  
 31161                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 31162                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 31163                                  
 31164                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 31165                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 31166                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 31167                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 31168                                  %endif
 31169                                  
 31170                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 31171 00002132 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 31172                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 31173 00002137 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 31174                                  
 31175                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 31176 00002139 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 31177                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 31178 0000213B 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 31179                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 31180                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 31181                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 31182                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31183 0000213F E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 31184                                  
 31185 00002141 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 31186                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 31187 00002144 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 31188 00002145 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 31189 00002148 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 31190

 31192                                  
 31193                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 31194                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 31195                                  	; 08/07/2023

 31197 0000214C 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 31198                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 31199                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 31200 0000214D 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 31201 0000214E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 31202 0000214F C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 31208

 31210                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma

 31215                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31216                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 31217                                  ;
 31218                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 31219                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 31220                                  ;
 31221                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 31222                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 31223                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 31224                                  ;
 31225                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 31226                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 31227                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 31228                                  
 31229                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 31230                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 31231                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 31232                                  ;
 31233                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 31234                                  
 31235                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 31236                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31237                                  
 31238                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 31239                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 31240                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 31241                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31242 00002166 BD[8619]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 31243                                  
 31244                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 31245 00002169 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 31246 0000216B 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 31247                                  
 31248                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 31249 0000216D 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 31250 0000216F 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 31251                                  
 31252 00002171 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 31253                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 31254                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31255 00002172 C3                      	retn
 31256                                  
 31257                                  ; 12/12/2022
 31258                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 31259                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 31260                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 31261                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 31262                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 31263                                  
 31264                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 31265                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 31266 00002173 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 31267 00002175 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 31268                                  
 31269 00002177 2E800E[7D19]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 31270                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 31271                                  
 31272                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31273                                  	; cf=0
 31274                                  	;retn
 31275                                  
 31276                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 31277                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31278                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 31279 0000217D F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 31280                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 31281                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 31282 0000217E C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 31285                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 31286                                  ;
 31287                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 31288                                  ;
 31289                                  ;  Input:
 31290                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 31291                                  ;
 31292                                  ;  Output:
 31293                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 31294                                  ;
 31295                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 31296                                  ;
 31297                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 31298                                  ;***************************************************************************

 31300                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 31301 0000217F 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 31302 00002180 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 31303 00002181 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31304                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 31305                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;

 31308 00002187 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 31309 00002189 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 31310 0000218B 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 31311 0000218C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31312 0000218D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 31313 0000218E 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 31314 0000218F 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 31315 00002190 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 31316 00002191 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 31317                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 31318                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 31319 00002192 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 31320 00002194 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 31321 00002197 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 31322                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 31323 00002199 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31324 0000219B 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31325 0000219D 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 31326 0000219E 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 31327 0000219F 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 31328 000021A0 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 31329 000021A1 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 31330 000021A2 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 31331 000021A3 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 31332 000021A4 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 31333                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 31334 000021A6 2E8936[7819]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 31335 000021AB 2E891E[7A19]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 31336                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 31337                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 31338                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 31339                                  	; 08/07/2023
 31340 000021B0 2EC536[7819]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 31341                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 31342 000021B5 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 31343 000021B8 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 31344 000021BA 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 31345 000021BC 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 31346 000021BE 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 31347 000021C1 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 31348 000021C3 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 31349 000021C4 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 31350                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 31351 000021C6 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 31352 000021C7 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 31353                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 31354 000021C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 31355                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 31356                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31357                                  	; cf=0
 31358                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 31359                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 31360 000021CA 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31361 000021CB 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 31362 000021CC 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 31363 000021CD C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 31979                                  
 31980                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 31981                                  
 31982                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31983                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31984                                  
 31985                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 31986                                  ;
 31987                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 31988                                  ;
 31989                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31990                                  ;
 31991                                  ;   Modification log:
 31992                                  ;
 31993                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 31994                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 31995                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 31996                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 31997                                  ;
 31998                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31999                                  ;
 32000                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 32001                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 32002                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 32003                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 32004                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 32005                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 32006                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 32007                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 32008                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 32009                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 32010                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 32011                                  ;
 32012                                  ;******************************************************************************
 32013                                  
 32014                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 32015                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 32016                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 32017                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 32018                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 32019                                  
 32020                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 32021                                  
 32022                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 32023                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 32024                                  
 32025                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 32026                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 32027                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 32028                                  
 32029                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 32030                                  ;
 32031                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 32032                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 32033                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 32034                                  ;	           line.
 32035                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 32036                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 32037                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 32038                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 32039                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 32040                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 32041                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 32042                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 32043                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 32044                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 32045                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 32046                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 32047                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 32048                                  ;	           for details).
 32049                                  
 32050 000023FB 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 32051 000023FC 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 32052 000023FD 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 32053 000023FF 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 32054 00002400 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 32055 00002410 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 32056 00002430 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 32057 00002431 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 32058 00002432 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 32059                                  
 32060                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 32061                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 32062                                  
 32063                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 32064                                  
 32065                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 32197                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 32198                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear

 32345 00002535 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0

 32347                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 32348 00002537 8826[6619]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0

 32350                                  
 32351 0000253F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 32352 00002541 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 32353                                  
 32354                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32355                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 32356                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32357                                  ;%if 0
 32358                                  
 32359                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32360                                  
 32361                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 32362                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 32363                                  
 32364 00002543 A2[6419]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 32365                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 32366 00002546 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 32367                                  
 32368                                  	; 08/09/2023
 32369 00002548 3826[6519]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 32370                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 32371 0000254C 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 32372                                  
 32373 0000254E 50                              push    ax                      ;
 32374 0000254F E85D22                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 32375 00002552 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 32376 00002554 E85822                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 32377 00002557 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 32378 00002559 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 32379 0000255C 58                              pop     ax
 32380                                  ;
 32381                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 32382                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 32383                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 32384                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 32385                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 32386                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 32387                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 32388                                  ;   spot.
 32389                                  ;
 32390                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 32391                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 32392                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 32393                                  ;   retrieved.
 32394                                  ;
 32395 0000255D 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 32396 00002562 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 32397                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 32398 00002564 F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 32399 00002569 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 32400 0000256B 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 32401 00002570 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 32402                                  final:                                  ;
 32403 00002572 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 32404                                  not_final:                              ;
 32405                                  ;endif
 32406                                  
 32407                                  ; 31/12/2022
 32408                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 32409                                  
 32410 00002575 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 32411 00002577 E83522                  	call	getchr
 32412 0000257A 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 32413                                  
 32414 0000257C 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 32415                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 32416                                  	; 27/10/2022
 32417 00002581 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 32418 00002583 E90009                  	jmp	badop
 32419                                  	
 32420                                  coff:	
 32421                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32422                                  	; ds = cs
 32423                                  	;push	cs
 32424                                  	;pop	ds
 32425 00002586 E81D22                  	call	newline

 32427                                  
 32428                                  blank_line:
 32429 0000258B E82122                  	call	getchr
 32430 0000258E EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 32431                                  
 32432                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32433                                  ; 11/12/2022
 32434                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 32435                                  ;coff_p:
 32436                                  	;push	cs
 32437                                  	;pop	ds
 32438                                  
 32439                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 32440                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 32441                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 32442                                  ;install= command.
 32443                                  
 32444                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32445                                  ;install command
 32446                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32447                                  
 32448                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 32449                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 32450                                  tryi:
 32451 00002590 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 32452 00002595 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 32453 00002597 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 32454                                  not_init_pass:
 32455 0000259A 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 32456                                          ; 11/12/2022
 32457                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 32458 0000259F 74E5                    	je	short coff
 32459                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32460                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 32461                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 32462                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 32463                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 32464                                  					; and before install= commands
 32465                                  					; are processed
 32466                                  
 32467 000025A1 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 32468 000025A6 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 32469 000025A8 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 32470                                  	; 11/12/2022
 32471                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 32472 000025AB 74D9                    	je	short coff
 32473                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32474                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 32475                                  
 32476                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 32477                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 32478                                          
 32479 000025AD 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 32480                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32481 000025B0 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 32482                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32483                                  	;jne	short tryb	
 32484                                  	
 32485                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 32486 000025B2 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 32487                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 32488 000025B7 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 32489                                  
 32490                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32491                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)
 32492                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 32493                                  ;%if 0
 32494                                  precheck_installhigh:
 32495 000025B9 80FC57                  	cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 32496 000025BC 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 32497                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 32498 000025BE 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 32499 000025C3 EBC1                    	jmp	short coff

 33390                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 33391                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 33392                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 33393                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 33394                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the

 33396                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 33397                                  ;
 33398                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device

 33836                                  
 33837                                  ;;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 33838                                  
 33839                                  ;	Now check for two special MagicDrv cases:
 33840                                  ;
 33841                                  ;       a) the last driver load was MagicDrv final placement:
 33842                                  ;	   -> add number of MagicDrv reserved drives to drivenumber
 33843                                  ;
 33844                                  ;       b) MagicDrv is currently in temporary home:
 33845                                  ;          -> call it to give it a chance to mount and shuffle drives
 33846                                  
 33847                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:MagicHomeFlag],0 ; already home?
 33848                                  	; 13/04/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 33849 00002A4D 2EF606[6724]01          	test	byte [cs:MagicHomeFlag],1 ; already home?
 33850 00002A53 7545                    	jnz	short no_more_magic_calls ;  nothing more to do if so
 33851                                  
 33852                                  ;	Now inquire of driver whether it is present, and final located
 33853                                  
 33854                                  	;mov	ax,multMagicdrv ; 4A11h

 33856                                  	;int	2fh			; ch = number of MagicDrv drive letters

 33859                                  	;;;

 33869                                  ;	don't keep checking it, and add its number of drive letters
 33870                                  ;	to drivenumber.
 33871

 33873                                  	;mov	byte [cs:MagicHomeFlag],0ffh ; set the flag!

 33875                                  					;  the drive number we'll pass to the

 33877                                  	;jmp	short no_more_magic_calls ; and finished.

 34397                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34398                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 34399                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 34400                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 34401                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 34402                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 34403                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 34404                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 34405                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34406                                  
 34407                                  ;**************************************************************************
 34408                                  ;									  *
 34409                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 34410                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 34411                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 34412                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 34413                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 34414                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 34415                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 34416                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 34417                                  ; input :								  *
 34418                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 34419                                  ; output:								  *
 34420                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 34421                                  ;									  *
 34422                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 34423                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 34424                                  ; logic:								  *
 34425                                  ; {									  *
 34426                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 34427                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 34428                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 34429                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 34430                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 34431                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 34432                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34433                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 34434                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34435                                  ;	     }								  *
 34436                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 34437                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 34438                                  ;	};								  *
 34439                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 34440                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 34441                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 34442                                  ; };									  *
 34443                                  ;**************************************************************************

 34791                                  ;************************************************************************
 34792                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*

 34795                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*

 35256                                  sysinit_parse:
 35257                                  
 35258                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35259                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 35260                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 35261                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 35262                                  ;
 35263                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 35264                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 35265                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 35266                                  ;	*** after each call.
 35267                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 35268                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 35269                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 35270                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 35271                                  ;	 procedure.
 35272                                  ;	ax - exit code
 35273                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 35274                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 35275                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 35276                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 35277                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35278                                  
 35279                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 35625                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 35626                                  ;
 35627                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 35628                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 35629                                  ;
 35630                                  ;	Output : none
 35631                                  ;
 35632                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 35633                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 35634                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35635                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 35636                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35637                                  ;
 35638                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 35645                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 35646 00002F0F E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 35647 00002F12 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 35648                                  	; 13/05/2019
 35649                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 35650                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 35651                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 35652                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35653                                  	; ds = cs
 35654 00002F14 803E[5124]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 35655 00002F19 74F0                    	je	short limx
 35656 00002F1B A1[3724]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 35657                                  lim_set:
 35658                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35659                                  	; 11/12/2022

 35662                                  	;retn
 35663
