 35666                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35667                                  ;
 35668                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 35669                                  ;
 35670                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 35671                                  ;	Output : none
 35672                                  ;
 35673                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 35674                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 35675                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 35676                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 35677                                  ;
 35678                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35679                                  
 35680                                  	; 01/11/2022
 35681                                  SetInt12Mem:
 35682 00002F1E 1E                      	push	ds
 35683 00002F1F BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 35684 00002F22 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 35685 00002F24 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 35686                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 35687 00002F28 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 35688 00002F2A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 35689 00002F2C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 35690                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 35691 00002F2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 35692                                  	; 14/04/2024
 35693                                  	; ds = cs
 35694 00002F30 891E[5524]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 35695 00002F34 C606[5424]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 35696                                  ;limx:
 35697 00002F39 C3                      	retn
 35698                                  
 35699                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35700                                  ;
 35701                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 35702                                  ;
 35703                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 35704                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 35705                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 35706                                  ;
 35707                                  ;	Output : none
 35708                                  ;
 35709                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 35710                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 35711                                  ;
 35712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35713                                  
 35714                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 35715                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35716                                  	; ds = cs
 35717 00002F3A 803E[5424]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35718                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 35719                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 35720                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 35721 00002F3F 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 35722                                  	; 18/12/2022
 35723 00002F41 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 35724 00002F44 8826[5424]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 35725                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35726                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 35727 00002F48 1E                      	push	ds
 35728                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 35729 00002F49 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 35730 00002F4B 2EA1[5524]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 35731 00002F4F A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 35732 00002F52 1F                      	pop	ds
 35733                                  timx:
 35734 00002F53 C3                      	retn

 35787                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35788                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 35789                                  
 35790                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 35791                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 35792                                  
 35793                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35794                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 35795                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35796                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35797                                  
 35798                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35799                                  ;
 35800                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 35801                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 35802                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 35803                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 35804                                  ;
 35805                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 35806                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 35807                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 35808                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 35809                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 35810                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 35811                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 35812                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 35813                                  ; available during the load.
 35814                                  ;
 35815                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 35816                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 35817                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 35818                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 35819                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 35820                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 35821                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 35822                                  ;
 35823                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 35824                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 35825                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 35826                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 35827                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 35828                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 35829                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 35830                                  ;
 35831                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35832                                  
 35833                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 35834                                  
 35835                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 35836                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 35837                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 35838                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 35839                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 35840                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 35841                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 35842                                  
 35843                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 35844                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 35845                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 35846                                  
 35847                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35848                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 35849                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35850                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 35851                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 35852                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 35853                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35854                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35855                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 35856                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 35857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35858                                  
 35859                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 35865

 35867                                  	; 03/01/2023

 35870                                  	;push	di

 35872                                  
 35873                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 35874 00002F7F 0E                      	push	cs

 35876                                  
 35877 00002F81 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 35878                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)

 35917                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35918                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 35919                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35920                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 35921                                  ; EXIT    : None
 35922                                  ; ERROR   : None
 35923                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 35924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35925                                  
 35926                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35927                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 35928                                  FixMem:
 35929                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35930                                  	;push	ax
 35931                                  	;push	bx
 35932                                  	;push	cx
 35933                                  	;push	dx
 35934 00002FA6 06                      	push	es
 35935                                  
 35936 00002FA7 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 35937                                  
 35938 00002FAA E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 35939 00002FAD 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 35940                                  
 35941 00002FAF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 35942                                  
 35943                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 35944                                  
 35945 00002FB1 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 35946 00002FB3 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 35947 00002FB5 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 35948                                  
 35949                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35950                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 35951                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 35952                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35953                                  
 35954 00002FB6 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 35955 00002FBA 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 35956 00002FBF 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 35957 00002FC1 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 35958                                  
 35959                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 35960                                  
 35961 00002FC3 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 35962 00002FC8 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 35963 00002FCA 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 35964                                  
 35965 00002FCE 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 35966                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 35967                                  	; 11/07/2023
 35968 00002FD3 43                      	inc	bx
 35969 00002FD4 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 35970                                  
 35971                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35972                                  
 35973 00002FD9 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 35974 00002FDB 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 35975                                  
 35976 00002FE0 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 35977 00002FE2 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35978 00002FE7 43                      	inc	bx
 35979 00002FE8 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 35980                                  
 35981                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 35982 00002FEA 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 35983 00002FEC 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 35984                                  fmX:	
 35985 00002FEE E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 35986                                  
 35987 00002FF1 07                      	pop	es
 35988                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35989                                  	;pop	dx
 35990                                  	;pop	cx
 35991                                  	;pop	bx
 35992                                  	;pop	ax
 35993                                  
 35994 00002FF2 C3                      	retn
 35995                                  
 35996                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35997                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 35998                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35999                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 36000                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 36001                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36002                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 36003                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36004                                  
 36005                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36006                                  fm_link:
 36007 00002FF3 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 36008 00002FF6 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 36009                                  
 36010                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 36011                                  	;
 36012                                  	;push	es
 36013                                  	;push	cs
 36014                                  	;pop	es
 36015                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 36016                                  	;pop	es
 36017                                  	
 36018                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36019                                  	; ds = cs
 36020                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 36021 00002FF8 A2[3024]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 36022                                  
 36023 00002FFB B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 36024 00002FFE BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 36025 00003001 CD21                    	int	21h
 36026 00003003 C3                      	retn
 36027                                  
 36028                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36029                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 36030                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36031                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 36032                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36033                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36034                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 36035                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36036

 36038                                  fm_unlink:
 36039 00003004 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 36040                                  	
 36041                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 36042                                  	;
 36043                                  	;push	ds
 36044                                  	;push	cs
 36045                                  	;pop	ds
 36046                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 36047                                  	;pop	ds
 36048                                  	
 36049                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36050                                  	; ds = cs
 36051                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 36052 00003006 8A1E[3024]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 36053                                  
 36054 0000300A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 36055 0000300D CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 36056 0000300F C3                      	retn

 36060                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36061                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 36062                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 36063                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36064                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 36065                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 36066                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 36067                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 36068                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36069                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 36070                                  ;
 36071                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 36072                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 36073                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 36074                                  ;
 36075                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 36076                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 36077                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 36078                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 36079                                  ;
 36080                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 36081                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 36082                                  ;
 36083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36084                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 36085                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 36086                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 36087                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 36088                                  ;     lh
 36089                                  ;     /l
 36090                                  ;     1
 36091                                  ;     1000
 36092                                  ;     2
 36093                                  ;     print
 36094                                  ;     /d
 36095                                  ;     :lpt2
 36096                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 36097                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 36098                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 36099                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 36100                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 36101                                  ; for:
 36102                                  ;    Each /L
 36103                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 36104                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 36105                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 36106                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 36107                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 36108                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36109                                  
 36110                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36111                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 36112                                  
 36113                                  ParseVar:
 36114                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 36115                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36116                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 36117 00003010 1E                      	push	ds
 36118 00003011 06                      	push	es
 36119                                  
 36120 00003012 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 36121 00003013 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 36122 00003014 FC                      	cld
 36123                                  
 36124                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 36125                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 36126                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 36127                                  
 36128 00003015 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 36129 00003016 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 36130 00003019 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 36131                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36132 0000301B 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 36133 0000301D 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 36134                                  
 36135 0000301F 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 36136 00003020 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 36137 00003021 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 36138                                  
 36139 00003023 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 36140                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 36141 00003024 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 36142                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 36143 00003026 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 36144 00003028 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 36145                                  
 36146                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 36147 0000302A 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 36148                                  
 36149                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 36150                                  	;
 36151                                  	;push	es
 36152                                  	;push	cs
 36153                                  	;pop	es
 36154                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 36155                                  	;pop	es
 36156                                  
 36157 0000302F 2EC606[FC23]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 36158                                  
 36159 00003035 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 36160                                  
 36161                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 36162 00003037 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 36163 00003039 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 36164                                  
 36165                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 36166 0000303B 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 36167                                  
 36168 00003040 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 36169 00003043 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 36170                                  
 36171 00003045 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 36172 00003046 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 36173                                  
 36174                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 36175 00003048 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 36176 0000304B 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 36177 0000304C 4E                      	dec	si
 36178 0000304D F9                      	stc
 36179                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 36180 0000304E 07                      	pop	es
 36181 0000304F 1F                      	pop	ds
 36182                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36183                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 36184 00003050 C3                      	retn
 36185                                  
 36186                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36187                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 36188                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36189                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 36190                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 36191                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 36192                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 36193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36194                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 36195                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 36196                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 36197                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 36198                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36199                                  
 36200                                  parseL:
 36201 00003051 AC                      	lodsb
 36202 00003052 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 36203 00003054 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 36204                                  
 36205                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 36206                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 36207                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 36208                                  
 36209 00003056 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 36210 00003059 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 36211 0000305B E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 36212                                  
 36213 0000305E 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 36214 00003060 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 36215 00003063 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 36216                                  
 36217                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 36218 00003065 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36219                                  
 36220 0000306A AC                      	lodsb
 36221 0000306B 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 36222 0000306D 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 36223                                  
 36224 0000306F E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 36225 00003072 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 36226                                  
 36227 00003074 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 36228 00003077 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 36229                                  
 36230                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36231 00003079 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 36232 0000307B 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 36233                                  
 36234 0000307D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 36235 0000307F 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 36236                                  
 36237                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 36238                                  
 36239 00003081 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 36240 00003084 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 36241                                  
 36242 00003086 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 36243                                  
 36244 00003089 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 36245                                  
 36246                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 36247 0000308C 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36248                                  
 36249 00003091 AC                      	lodsb
 36250 00003092 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 36251 00003094 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 36252                                  
 36253 00003096 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 36254 00003099 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 36255                                  
 36256 0000309B E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 36257 0000309E 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 36258                                  
 36259                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36260 000030A0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 36261 000030A2 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 36262                                  plE1:	
 36263                                  	;mov	ax,1
 36264 000030A4 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 36265 000030A7 4E                      	dec	si
 36266 000030A8 F9                      	stc
 36267 000030A9 C3                      	retn
 36268                                  
 36269                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 36270 000030AA B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 36271                                  	; 12/12/2022
 36272                                  	; cf=1
 36273                                  	;stc
 36274 000030AD C3                      	retn
 36275                                  plSwX:	
 36276 000030AE 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 36277                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 36278                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 36279                                  	; cf=0
 36280                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 36281 000030AF C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 36282                                  
 36283                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36284                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 36285                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36286                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 36287                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36288                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36289                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 36290                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36291                                  
 36292                                  ;incArgc:
 36293                                  	;push	ax
 36294                                  
 36295                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 36296                                  
 36297                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 36298                                  
 36299                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 36300                                  
 36301                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 36302                                  
 36303                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 36304                                  
 36305                                  	;pop	ax
 36306                                  	;retn
 36307                                  
 36308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36309                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 36310                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36311                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 36312                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 36313                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36314                                  ; USES:     ZF
 36315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36316                                  
 36317                                  isEOL:
 36318 000030B0 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 36319 000030B2 7406                    	je	short ieX
 36320 000030B4 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 36321 000030B6 7402                    	je	short ieX
 36322 000030B8 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 36323                                  ieX:	
 36324 000030BA C3                      	retn
 36325                                  
 36326                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36327                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 36328                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36329                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 36330                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 36331                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36332                                  ; USES:     ZF
 36333                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36334                                  
 36335                                  isWhite:
 36336 000030BB 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space

 36339 000030C1 7402                    	je	short iwX

 36341                                  iwX:	
 36342 000030C5 C3                      	retn

 36395                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36396                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 36397                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 36398                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 36399                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 36400                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36401                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 36402                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36403                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 36404                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 36405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36406                                  
 36407                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36408                                  stowUMB:
 36409 000030D9 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 36410 000030DB 7202                    	jb	short su10
 36411 000030DD F9                      	stc
 36412 000030DE C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 36413                                  su10:	
 36414                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36415                                  	;push	bx
 36416                                  	;push	di
 36417                                  	;push	si
 36418                                  	;push	ds
 36419                                  	;push	es
 36420                                  	;push	cs
 36421                                  	;pop	es
 36422                                  	;push	cs
 36423                                  	;pop	ds
 36424                                  
 36425                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36426                                  	; ds <> cs
 36427                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 36428 000030DF 2E803E[FF23]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 36429                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 36430 000030E5 7504                    	jne	short su20
 36431 000030E7 2EA2[FF23]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36432                                  
 36433                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 36434                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 36435                                  	;jne	short su20
 36436                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36437                                  su20:	
 36438 000030EB 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 36439 000030ED 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 36440                                  
 36441                                  	;mov	bl,al
 36442                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 36443                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 36444                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36445 000030EF 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 36446 000030F1 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 36447 000030F3 B001                    	mov	al,1
 36448                                  
 36449                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 36450                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36451 000030F5 2E8687[0024]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 36452                                  
 36453                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 36454                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 36455                                  	;
 36456                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 36457                                  	
 36458                                  	; 01/01/2023

 36460 000030FC F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 36461                                  su30:	
 36462                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36463                                  	;pop	es
 36464                                  	;pop	ds
 36465                                  	;pop	si
 36466                                  	;pop	di
 36467                                  	;pop	bx
 36468 000030FD C3                      	retn

 36508                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36509                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 36510                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 36511                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 36512                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 36513                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36514                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 36515                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 36516                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 36517                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 36518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36519                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 36520                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 36521                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 36522                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36523                                  
 36524                                  gnradix:
 36525 000030FE 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 36526                                  
 36527                                  toDigit:
 36528 00003100 2E833E[FE30]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 36529 00003106 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 36530                                  
 36531                                  toDigit_hex:
 36532 00003108 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 36533 0000310B 7209                    	jb	short td10
 36534 0000310D 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 36535 00003110 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 36536 00003112 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 36537                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36538 00003115 C3                      	retn
 36539                                  td10:	
 36540 00003116 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 36541 00003119 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 36542 0000311B 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 36543 0000311E 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 36544 00003120 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 36545                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36546 00003123 C3                      	retn
 36547                                  toDigit_dec:
 36548                                  td20:	
 36549 00003124 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 36550                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 36551 00003127 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 36552 00003129 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 36553 0000312C 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 36554 0000312E 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 36555                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36556 00003131 C3                      	retn
 36557                                  tdE:	
 36558 00003132 F9                      	stc
 36559                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 36560 00003133 C3                      	retn
 36561                                  
 36562                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36563                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 36564                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36565                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 36566                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 36567                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 36568                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 36569                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36570                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 36571                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 36572                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 36573                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36574                                  
 36575                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36576                                  
 36577                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36578                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 36579                                  
 36580                                  GetXNum:
 36581                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 36582                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36583                                  	;push	bx
 36584 00003134 51                      	push	cx ; *
 36585                                  	;push	ds
 36586                                  
 36587 00003135 FC                      	cld
 36588 00003136 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 36589 00003138 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 36590 0000313A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 36591 0000313C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 36592                                  
 36593 0000313E 2EC706[FE30]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 36594                                  
 36595 00003145 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 36596                                  	;call	toDigit
 36597 00003148 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 36598                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 36599                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36600 0000314B 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 36601                                  
 36602 0000314D 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 36603 0000314F 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 36604 00003151 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 36605 00003155 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 36606 00003158 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 36607 0000315A 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 36608 0000315D 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 36609                                  
 36610                                  gxn10:	
 36611 0000315F 2EC706[FE30]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 36612 00003166 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 36613 00003167 46                      	inc	si
 36614                                  
 36615                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 36616                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 36617                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 36618                                  ;        BX    = 0
 36619                                  ;        CH    = 0
 36620                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 36621                                  
 36622                                  gxn20:	
 36623 00003168 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 36624 0000316B 46                      	inc	si
 36625                                  
 36626 0000316C E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 36627 0000316F 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 36628                                  
 36629 00003171 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 36630 00003174 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 36631                                  
 36632 00003176 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 36633 00003178 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 36634                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 36635                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 36636 0000317A 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 36637                                  gxnE:	
 36638                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 36639 0000317C EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 36640                                  gxnQ:	
 36641 0000317E 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 36642 0000317F F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 36643                                  gxnX:	
 36644                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36645                                  	;pop	ds
 36646 00003180 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 36647                                  	;pop	bx
 36648 00003181 C3                      	retn
 36649                                  
 36650                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36651                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 36652                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36653                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 36654                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 36655                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 36656                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36658                                  
 36659                                  mul32:
 36660 00003182 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36661 00003183 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36662 00003185 2EF726[FE30]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36663 0000318A 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 36664                                  
 36665 0000318C 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36666 0000318E 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36667                                  
 36668 0000318F 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36669 00003191 2EF726[FE30]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36670 00003196 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36671 00003198 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36672 0000319A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36673 0000319C C3                      	retn
 36674                                  m32E:	
 36675 0000319D 58                      	pop	ax
 36676 0000319E C3                      	retn
 36677                                  
 36678                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36679                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 36680                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36681                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 36682                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 36683                                  ; ERROR:   None
 36684                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36686                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 36687                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 36688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36689                                  
 36690                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36691                                  toPara:
 36692 0000319F 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 36693                                  
 36694 000031A0 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 36695 000031A2 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 36696 000031A4 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 36697 000031A5 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 36698 000031A7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 36699 000031A9 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 36700                                  
 36701 000031AB 59                      	pop	cx
 36702 000031AC C3                      	retn

 36704                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36705                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 36706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36707                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 36708                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 36709                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 36710                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36711                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36712                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 36713                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 36714                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 36715                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 36716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36718                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 36729

 36731 000031AF CD21                    	int	21h
 36732                                  
 36733 000031B1 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 36734                                  	
 36735                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36736 000031B5 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 36737 000031B8 F5                      	cmc
 36738                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1

 36790                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36791                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 36792                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36793                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 36794                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 36795                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 36796                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36797                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36798                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 36799                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 36800                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 36801                                  ;      ...
 36802                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 36803                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36804                                  
 36805                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36806                                  AddrToUmb:
 36807                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36808                                  	;push	cx
 36809                                  	;push	dx
 36810 000031CA 06                      	push	es
 36811

 36813

 36816

 36821                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36822                                  atu10:

 36883                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36884                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 36885                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 36886                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 36887                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 36888                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36890                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number

 36906 00003209 48                      	dec	ax

 37445                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37446                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 37447                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 37448                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37449                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 37450                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 37451                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 37452                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 37453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37454                                  
 37455                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 37456                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 37457                                  findUMB:
 37458                                  	; 01/01/2023
 37459                                  	;push	ax
 37460                                  	; 02/01/2023
 37461 000032D3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 37462                                  	;push	dx
 37463                                  
 37464 000032D4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 37465                                  
 37466 000032D6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 37467                                  
 37468 000032D8 E8D2FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 37469                                  	; 22/07/2023
 37470                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 37471 000032DB 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 37472                                  
 37473                                  	; 22/07/2023
 37474                                  fu10:
 37475 000032DD 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 37476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 37477                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 37478                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 37479                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 37480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 37481                                  
 37482                                  ;fu10:	
 37483 000032DF 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 37484 000032E1 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 37485                                  
 37486 000032E3 E8D4FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 37487 000032E6 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 37488                                  
 37489 000032E8 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 37490                                  fu20:	
 37491                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 37492                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 37493                                  	; 19/07/2023
 37494 000032E9 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 37495 000032EF 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 37496                                  
 37497                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 37498                                  	; 22/07/2023
 37499                                  	; ax = es
 37500                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 22/07/2023
 37501                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 37502 000032F1 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 37503 000032F6 40                      	inc	ax
 37504                                  	; 22/07/2023
 37505                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 37506 000032F7 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 37507                                  fuE:	
 37508 000032F9 F9                      	stc
 37509                                  fuX:
 37510                                  	; 01/01/2023
 37511                                  	;pop	dx
 37512                                  	; 02/01/2023
 37513 000032FA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 37514                                  	;pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 37515 000032FB C3                      	retn
 37516                                  
 37517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37518                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 37519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37520                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 37521                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 37522                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 37523                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 37524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37525                                  
 37526                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 37527                                  BigFree:
 37528                                  	; 01/01/2023
 37529                                  	;push	bx
 37530 000032FC 51                      	push	cx
 37531                                  
 37532 000032FD E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 37533 00003300 723A                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 37534                                  
 37535 00003302 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 37536 00003304 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 37537                                  
 37538                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 37539                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 37540                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 37541                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 37542                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 37543                                  
 37544                                  bf10:	
 37545 00003306 E8B1FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 37546 00003309 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 37547                                  
 37548                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 37549 0000330B 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 37550 00003311 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 37551                                  
 37552 00003313 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 37553                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 37554 00003317 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 37555                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 37556                                  	; 19/07/2023
 37557 00003319 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 37558                                  
 37559 0000331B 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 37560                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; and its size.
 37561 0000331D 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 37562                                  
 37563                                  bf20:	
 37564                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 37565                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end	; 'Z'
 37566                                  	; 19/07/2023
 37567                                  	;cmp	byte [es:0],'Z'
 37568 0000331F 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 37569 00003325 740C                    	jz	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 37570                                  
 37571                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 37572 00003327 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 37573                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 37574 00003329 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 37575 0000332E 40                      	inc     ax
 37576 0000332F 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 37577                                  
 37578 00003331 EBD3                    	jmp	short bf10
 37579                                  
 37580 00003333 8EC3                    bf30:	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 37581 00003335 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 37582 00003337 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 37583 00003339 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 37584                                  bfE:	
 37585 0000333B F9                      	stc
 37586                                  bfX:
 37587 0000333C 59                      	pop	cx
 37588                                  	; 01/01/2023
 37589                                  	;pop	bx
 37590 0000333D C3                      	retn
 37591                                  
 37592                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37593                                  ;*** isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 37594                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 37596                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if UMB wasn't specified, ZF clear if it was
 37597                                  ; ERROR:    None
