 39851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39852                                  ;
 39853                                  ; procedure : UnlinkUMB
 39854                                  ;
 39855                                  ;	Unlinks the UMBs from the DOS arena chain
 39856                                  ;
 39857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39858                                  
 39859                                  UnlinkUMB:
 39860                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39861                                  	; ds = cs
 39862 000039F6 1E                      	push	ds
 39863 000039F7 06                      	push	es
 39864                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39865 000039F8 803E[5F24]00            	cmp	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0
 39866                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0
 39867 000039FD 7420                    	je	short ulu_x		; nothing to unlink
 39868                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39869 000039FF 8E06[6024]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 39870                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]	; get DOS data seg
 39871 00003A03 268E1E2400              	mov	ds,[es:DOS_ARENA]
 39872 00003A08 268B3E8C00              	mov	di,[es:UMB_ARENA]
 39873                                  ulu_next:
 39874 00003A0D E83BFF                  	call	get_next
 39875 00003A10 720D                    	jc	short ulu_x
 39876 00003A12 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; is the next one UMB ?
 39877 00003A14 7404                    	je	short ulu_found
 39878 00003A16 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 39879 00003A18 EBF3                    	jmp	short ulu_next
 39880                                  ulu_found:
 39881                                  	;mov	byte [0],'Z'
 39882 00003A1A C60600005A              	mov     byte [ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 39883                                  ulu_x:
 39884 00003A1F 07                      	pop	es
 39885 00003A20 1F                      	pop	ds
 39886 00003A21 C3                      	retn
 39887                                  
 39888                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39889                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 39890                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39891                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39892                                  
 39893                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 39894                                  ;
 39895                                  ; Summary:
 39896                                  ;
 39897                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 39898                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 39899                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 39900                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 39901                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 39902                                  ;
 39903                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 39904                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 39905                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 39906                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 39907                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 39908                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 39909                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 39910                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 39911                                  ;
 39912                                  ; Example:
 39913                                  ;
 39914                                  ;   [menu]
 39915                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 39916                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 39917                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 39918                                  ;
 39919                                  ;   [network]
 39920                                  ;   include misc
 39921                                  ;   device=foo
 39922                                  ;
 39923                                  ;   [misc]
 39924                                  ;   device=bar
 39925                                  ;   include alternate
 39926                                  ;
 39927                                  ;   [alternate]
 39928                                  ;   device=tar
 39929                                  ;
 39930                                  ;
 39931                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 39932                                  ;
 39933                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 39934                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 39935                                  ;
 39936                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 39937                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 39938                                  ;   following order:
 39939                                  ;
 39940                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 39941                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 39942                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 39943                                  ;
 39944                                  
 39945                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 39946                                  
 39947                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 39948                                  
 39949                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 39950                                  
 39951                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 39952                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 39953                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 39954                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 39955                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 39956                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 39957                                  
 39958                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39959                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39960                                  
 39961                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 39962                                  
 39963                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39964                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 39965                                  
 39966 00003A22 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0

 40103                                  ; procedure : parseline
 40104                                  ;
 40105                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 40106                                  ;
 40107                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40108                                  
 40109                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40110                                  	; (SYSINIT:3EDFh)
 40111                                  
 40112                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 40113                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 40114                                  parseline:
 40115                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40116                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 40117                                  
 40118                                  	;push	ds ; *
 40119                                  
 40120                                  	;push	cs ; *
 40121                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 40122                                  
 40123                                  nextswtch:
 40124                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 40125                                  	je	short done_line
 40126                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 40127                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 40128                                  
 40129                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 40130                                  
 40131                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 40132                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 40133                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 40134                                  	je	short getparm
 40135                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 40136                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 40137                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40138                                  swterr:
 40139                                  	retn
 40140                                  
 40141                                  getparm:
 40142                                  	call	check_switch
 40143                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 40144                                  	jc	short swterr
 40145                                  getnext:
 40146                                  	call	getchr
 40147                                  	;jc	short done_line
 40148                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 40149                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40150                                  	jnc	short nextswtch
 40151                                  ;swterr:
 40152                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 40153                                  
 40154                                  done_line:
 40155                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40156                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 40157                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 40158                                  	jnz	short okay
 40159                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 40160                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 40161                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40162                                  	retn
 40163                                  
 40164                                  okay:
 40165                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 40166                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 40167                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 40168                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 40169                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 40170                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 40171                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40172                                  	; cf=0
 40173                                  	;clc
 40174                                  	;call	setdeviceparameters
 40175                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40176                                  	jmp	setdeviceparameters
 40177                                  ;exitpl:
 40178                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40179                                  	; ds = cs
 40180                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 40181                                  	retn
 40182                                  put_back:
 40183                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 40184                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 40185                                  	jmp	short done_line
 40186

 40474                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40475                                  ;
 40476                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 40477                                  ;
 40478                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 40479                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 40480                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 40481                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 40482                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 40483                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 40484                                  ;
 40485                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 40486                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 40487                                  ;
 40488                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 40489                                  ;
 40490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40491                                  
 40492                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40493                                  
 40494                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 40495                                  
 40496                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40497                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)
 40498                                  
 40499                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 40500                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:4236h)
 40501                                  
 40502                                  setdeviceparameters:
 40503                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40504                                  	; ds = cs
 40505

 40507                                  
 40508 00003B48 0E                      	push	cs
 40509 00003B49 07                      	pop	es
 40510

 40514 00003B53 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 40515

 40517                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 40518                                  got_80:

 40553                                  
 40554                                  heads_not_altered:
 40555                                  
 40556                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 40557                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 40558                                  
 40559                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 40560                                  	; 02/11/2022
 40561                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 40562                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40563 00003B85 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 40564 00003B88 A2[C84D]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 40565                                  
 40566 00003B8B B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 40567                                  
 40568                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 40569                                  
 40570                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 40571                                  	; 02/11/2022
 40572 00003B8D 8A3E[D04D]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 40573                                  	
 40574                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40575                                  	; ax = 2
 40576 00003B91 3906[D54D]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 40577                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 40578 00003B95 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 40579                                  
 40580 00003B97 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 40581                                  
 40582                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 40583                                  
 40584 00003B99 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 40585                                  
 40586                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 40587                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 40588                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 40589                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 40590                                  
 40591                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 40592                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 40593                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 40594                                  
 40595 00003B9B 833E[D34D]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 40596 00003BA0 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 40597 00003BA2 833E[C34D]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 40598 00003BA7 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 40599                                  
 40600                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 40601                                  
 40602 00003BA9 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 40603                                  
 40604                                  ;	check for 320K
 40605                                  
 40606                                  not_144m:
 40607 00003BAB 833E[C34D]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 40608 00003BB0 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 40609 00003BB2 833E[D34D]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 40610 00003BB7 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 40611                                  
 40612 00003BB9 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 40613 00003BBB EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 40614                                  
 40615                                  only_one_head:
 40616                                  
 40617                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 40618                                  
 40619 00003BBD 803E[C04D]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 40620 00003BC2 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 40621                                  
 40622                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 40623                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 40624                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 40625                                  
 40626 00003BC4 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 40627 00003BC6 833E[D34D]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 40628                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40629 00003BCB 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 40630                                  
 40631 00003BCD B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 40632                                  
 40633                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 40634                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 40635                                  
 40636                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 40637                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40638                                  	; ax = 2
 40639 00003BCF 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 40640 00003BD0 A2[C84D]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 40641                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 40642                                  
 40643                                  got_correct_mediad:
 40644 00003BD3 881E[D04D]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 40645                                  
 40646                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 40647                                  
 40648 00003BD7 A1[C34D]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 40649 00003BDA F726[D54D]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS]
 40650 00003BDE F726[D34D]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 40651 00003BE2 A3[CE4D]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.TOTALSECTORS],ax
 40652 00003BE5 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 40653                                  
 40654 00003BE6 C3                      	retn
 40655

 41200                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41201                                  ;
 41202                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 41203                                  ;
 41204                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 41205                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 41206                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 41207                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 41208                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 41209                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 41210                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 41211                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 41212                                  ;
 41213                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41214                                  
 41215                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41216                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 41217                                  
 41218                                  skip_comment:
 41219 00003DEF E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 41220                                  
 41221                                  	; 03/01/2023
 41222                                  	; ds = cs	
 41223                                  
 41224 00003DF1 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 41225                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 41226 00003DF6 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 41227                                  
 41228 00003DF8 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 41229                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 41230 00003DFD 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 41231                                  
 41232 00003DFF 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 41233                                  	
 41234 00003E02 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 41235                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 41236 00003E06 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 41237                                  
 41238 00003E08 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 41239                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 41240 00003E0D 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 41241                                  
 41242 00003E0F 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 41243                                  	
 41244 00003E13 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 41245                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 41246 00003E17 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 41247                                  skip_cmmt:
 41248 00003E19 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 41249 00003E1B 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 41250 00003E1E 46                      	inc	si
 41251 00003E1F 49                      	dec	cx
 41252 00003E20 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 41253 00003E22 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 41254                                  no_commt:
 41255 00003E24 C3                      	retn

 41257                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41258                                  ; (SYSINIT:42C8h)
 41259                                  
 41260                                  ; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 41261                                  ;%if 0

 41263                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 41264                                  
 41265                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41266                                  ;
 41267                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 41268                                  ;
 41269                                  ;   INPUT
 41270                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41271                                  ;
 41272                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41273                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 41274                                  ;
 41275                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41276                                  ;       All
 41277                                  ;
 41278                                  ;   HISTORY
 41279                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41280                                  ;
 41281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41282                                  
 41283                                  kbd_read:
 41284 00003E25 F606[814C]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 41285 00003E2A 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 41286                                  
 41287 00003E2C 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 41288 00003E2D 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 41289 00003E2F 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 41290                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 41291                                  kbd_loop:
 41292 00003E31 B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 41293 00003E33 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 41294 00003E35 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 41295 00003E37 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41296 00003E39 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41297 00003E3B A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41298 00003E3D 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 41299 00003E3F A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 41300                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 41301                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41302 00003E42 2E2B06[8C03]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 41303                                  
 41304 00003E47 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 41305 00003E49 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 41306                                  kbd_loopdone:
 41307 00003E4B 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 41308                                  kbd_nodelay:
 41309 00003E4C 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 41310 00003E4E B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41311 00003E50 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41312 00003E52 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41313 00003E54 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 41314 00003E56 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 41315 00003E57 43                              inc     bx
 41316                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 41317 00003E58 800E[854C]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 41318                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 41319 00003E5D B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 41320 00003E5F CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41321 00003E61 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 41322 00003E63 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 41323 00003E65 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 41324                                  
 41325                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 41326 00003E67 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 41327 00003E6A 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 41328                                  	
 41329 00003E6C 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 41330 00003E6F 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 41331                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 41332 00003E71 BA[FC51]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 41333 00003E74 E8DD0B                          call    print
 41334                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 41335 00003E77 800E[854C]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 41336 00003E7C EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 41337                                  kbd_notf5:
 41338                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 41339 00003E7E 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 41340 00003E81 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 41341                                  
 41342 00003E83 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 41343 00003E86 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 41344                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 41345 00003E88 BA[3A52]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 41346 00003E8B E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 41347 00003E8E B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 41348 00003E90 881E[854C]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 41349                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 41350 00003E94 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 41351 00003E96 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 41352 00003E98 C606[8B4C]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 41353 00003E9D 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 41354 00003E9F 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 41355                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 41356 00003EA1 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 41357 00003EA4 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 41358                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 41359 00003EA6 E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 41360 00003EA9 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 41361 00003EAA C3                              retn			;
 41362                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 41363 00003EAB F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 41364 00003EAC C3                              retn			;
 41365                                  
 41366                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41367                                  ;
 41368                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 41369                                  ;
 41370                                  ;   INPUT
 41371                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 41372                                  ;
 41373                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41374                                  ;       None
 41375                                  ;
 41376                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41377                                  ;       None
 41378                                  ;
 41379                                  ;   HISTORY
 41380                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41381                                  ;
 41382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41383                                  
 41384                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 41385                                  
 41386                                  set_numlock:
 41387                                          ; 04/01/2023
 41388                                  	;push	ax
 41389 00003EAD 1E                              push    ds
 41390 00003EAE 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 41391 00003EB0 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 41392 00003EB2 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 41393 00003EB5 2E3B06[C451]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 41394 00003EBA 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 41395 00003EBC 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 41396 00003EC1 EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 41397                                  not_off:
 41398 00003EC3 2E3B06[C251]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 41399 00003EC8 F9                              stc
 41400 00003EC9 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 41401 00003ECB 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 41402                                  set_done:
 41403 00003ED0 1F                              pop     ds
 41404                                  	; 04/01/2023
 41405                                  	;pop	ax
 41406 00003ED1 C3                              retn
 41407                                  
 41408                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41409                                  
 41410                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41411                                  ;
 41412                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 41413                                  ;
 41414                                  ;   INPUT
 41415                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 41416                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 41417                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41418                                  ;
 41419                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41420                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 41421                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 41422                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 41423                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 41424                                  ;
 41425                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41426                                  ;       All
 41427                                  ;
 41428                                  ;   NOTES
 41429                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 41430                                  ;
 41431                                  ;   HISTORY
 41432                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 41433                                  ;
 41434                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41435                                  
 41436                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41437                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 41438                                  
 41439                                  menu_check:
 41440                                  
 41441                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 41442                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 41443                                  
 41444 00003ED2 51                              push    cx              ;
 41445 00003ED3 56                              push    si              ;
 41446 00003ED4 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 41447                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 41448 00003ED6 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 41449 00003ED9 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 41450 00003EDB 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 41451 00003EDD 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 41452 00003EDF 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 41453 00003EE0 EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41454                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 41455 00003EE2 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 41456 00003EE4 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 41457 00003EE6 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 41458 00003EE8 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 41459 00003EEA E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 41460 00003EED 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 41461 00003EF2 EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41462                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 41463 00003EF4 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 41464 00003EF6 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 41465                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 41466 00003EF8 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 41467                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 41468 00003EFB 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 41469 00003EFD 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 41470 00003EFF 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 41471 00003F01 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 41472 00003F03 E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 41473 00003F06 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 41474 00003F08 3A06[6323]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 41475 00003F0C 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 41476 00003F0E 800E[814C]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 41477 00003F13 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41478                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 41479 00003F15 3A06[6F23]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 41480 00003F19 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 41481 00003F1B 800E[814C]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 41482 00003F20 EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41483                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 41484 00003F22 E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41485 00003F25 EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 41486                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 41487 00003F27 5E                              pop     si              ;
 41488 00003F28 59                              pop     cx              ;
 41489                                  
 41490                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 41491                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 41492                                  
 41493 00003F29 F606[814C]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 41494 00003F2E 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 41495                                  ;
 41496                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 41497                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 41498                                  ;
 41499 00003F30 E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 41500 00003F33 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 41501 00003F35 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 41502                                  
 41503                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 41504                                  
 41505                                  menu_search:
 41506 00003F38 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 41507 00003F3A BF[C64C]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 41508 00003F3D E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 41509 00003F40 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 41510 00003F42 C606[BE4C]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 41511 00003F47 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 41512                                  
 41513                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 41514                                  
 41515                                  menu_color:
 41516 00003F4A 51                      	push	cx              ;
 41517 00003F4B 52                      	push	dx              ;
 41518                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 41519                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41520                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 41521 00003F4C E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 41522 00003F4F 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 41523 00003F52 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 41524                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 41525                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 41526                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 41527                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 41528 00003F54 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 41529 00003F56 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 41530 00003F59 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 41531 00003F5B E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 41532 00003F5E 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 41533 00003F61 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 41534                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41535                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 41536 00003F63 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 41537 00003F65 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 41538 00003F67 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 41539                                  check_color:
 41540 00003F69 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 41541 00003F6B 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 41542 00003F6D 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 41543                                  set_color:
 41544 00003F70 8816[7C4C]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 41545 00003F74 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 41546 00003F75 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 41547 00003F76 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 41548                                  
 41549                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 41550                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 41551                                  
 41552                                  menu_found:
 41553 00003F79 C606[864C]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 41554                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 41555 00003F7E C606[8A4C]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 41556 00003F83 8026[854C]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 41557                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41558 00003F88 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 41559 00003F8A 8916[884C]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 41560                                  
 41561 00003F8E E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 41562                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41563                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 41564                                  
 41565                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 41566                                  
 41567                                  menu_process:
 41568 00003F91 E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 41569 00003F94 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 41570 00003F96 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 41571 00003F98 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 41572 00003F9A 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 41573 00003F9C 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 41574 00003F9E 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 41575 00003FA0 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 41576 00003FA2 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 41577 00003FA4 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 41578 00003FA6 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 41579 00003FA8 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 41580 00003FAA 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 41581 00003FAC 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 41582 00003FAE 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 41583 00003FB0 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 41584 00003FB2 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 41585 00003FB4 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 41586 00003FB7 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 41587 00003FB9 F9                              stc                     ;
 41588 00003FBA E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 41589 00003FBD EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41590                                  menu_numlock:
 41591 00003FBF E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 41592 00003FC2 EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41593                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 41594 00003FC4 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 41595                                  
 41596                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 41597                                  
 41598                                  menu_default:
 41599 00003FC6 8936[884C]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 41600 00003FCA 803E[8B4C]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 41601 00003FCF 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 41602 00003FD1 E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 41603 00003FD4 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 41604 00003FD6 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 41605 00003FD9 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 41606 00003FDB 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 41607 00003FDD E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 41608 00003FE0 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 41609                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 41610 00003FE3 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 41611 00003FE5 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 41612                                  timeout_ok:                    ;
 41613 00003FE7 881E[8A4C]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 41614                                  timeout_skip:
 41615 00003FEB EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41616                                  
 41617                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 41618                                  
 41619                                  menu_item:
 41620                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 41621 00003FED 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 41622 00003FF0 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 41623 00003FF2 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 41624 00003FF4 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 41625 00003FF7 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 41626 00003FF9 F9                              stc                     ;
 41627 00003FFA E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 41628 00003FFD EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 41629                                  
 41630                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 41631                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 41632                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 41633                                  
 41634                                  menu_itemfound:
 41635 00003FFF 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 41636 00004000 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 41637 00004002 8887[8C4C]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 41638 00004006 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 41639                                  
 41640                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 41641                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 41642                                  ;   description...
 41643                                  
 41644 00004008 89B7[964C]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 41645 0000400C 89B7[AA4C]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 41646 00004010 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 41647 00004012 E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 41648 00004015 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41649 00004017 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 41650 0000401A 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41651 0000401C 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 41652 0000401E 89BF[AA4C]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 41653                                  
 41654                                  menu_nextitem:
 41655 00004022 E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41656 00004025 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 41657                                  
 41658                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 41659                                  
 41660                                  menu_getdefault:
 41661 00004028 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 41662 0000402A 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 41663 0000402C 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 41664 0000402E E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 41665                                  menu_valid:
 41666 00004031 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 41667 00004033 8816[874C]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 41668 00004037 8B3E[884C]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 41669 0000403B 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 41670 0000403D 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 41671 0000403F 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 41672                                  menu_chkdefault:
 41673 00004040 53                              push    bx              ;
 41674 00004041 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41675 00004043 8BB7[964C]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41676 00004047 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 41677 0000404A 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41678 0000404B 06                              push    es              ;
 41679 0000404C 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41680 0000404D E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 41681 00004050 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41682 00004051 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 41683 00004052 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 41684 00004054 43                              inc     bx              ;
 41685 00004055 3A1E[874C]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 41686 00004059 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 41687                                  menu_nodefault:
 41688 0000405B B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 41689                                  menu_setdefault:
 41690 0000405D 881E[864C]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 41691                                  
 41692                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 41693                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 41694                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 41695                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 41696                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 41697                                  ;   with no timeout)
 41698                                  
 41699 00004061 803E[8A4C]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 41700 00004066 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 41701 00004068 F606[854C]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 41702 0000406D 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 41703 0000406F E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 41704                                  
 41705                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 41706                                  
 41707                                  menu_display:
 41708 00004072 B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 41709 00004074 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41710 00004076 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 41711 00004078 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41712 0000407A 06                              push    es              ;
 41713 0000407B B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 41714 0000407E 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 41715 00004080 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 41716 00004084 A3[834C]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 41717 00004087 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 41718 0000408B A2[824C]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 41719 0000408E A1[7D4C]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 41720 00004091 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41721 00004093 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 41722 00004096 8A3E[7C4C]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 41723 0000409A 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 41724                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 41725 0000409C 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 41726 000040A1 FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 41727                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];

 41810                                  
 41811                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 41812                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 41813                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
